programme.desc: District attorney Mitch Brockden is involved in a fatal hit-and-run incident, and a convicted felon is charged with his crime. Crime thriller, starring Dominic Cooper and Samuel L Jackson

programme.title: The Exorcist III (1990)
programme.desc: A series of brutal, ritualistic murders leads policeman George C Scott to a patient in an asylum - and the deepening suspicion that the horrific killings might be linked to an exorcism performed 15 years earlier. Spine-chilling horror that's not a patch on the original but still a vast improvement on its first sequel, with Ed Flanders and Brad Dourif. Directed by William Peter Blatty, author of the book that spawned the series in the first place

programme.desc: A family moves into a house with a grisly history, the previous occupants having died under mysterious circumstances. The new tenants' teenage son delves into the building's past with a mysterious neighbour, and unwittingly disturb the monstrous supernatural forces lurking within. Horror, starring Harrison Gilbertson and Liana Liberato

programme.desc: When a sleepy town is hit by a zombie apocalypse, adventurous student Anna puts her plans for a gap year on hold as she and her friends get locked into a battle for survival. After 64 years, what was it like to see their country on the greatest stage of all?

programme.title: Merched Comin Greenham

Monika steps out of her usual gothic comfort zone to design a home for a group of friends called The Gin Club and Temi takes on a different approach for her eco-chalet. programme.desc: Kim and Denise try to break up Ravi and Chelsea, but Ravi has other plans. Callum receives an urgent work call that changes things for the people on the square and Freddie confronts his old teacher

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and his team of experts welcome Rokeya and Patricia into the Repair Shop who have brought in a painting that has been in their family since it was commissioned in the early 1950s. Kirsten Ramsay takes on the challenge of repairing a clay keepsake of Emese and Luke's son's footprints. David, who died at just five months old, was diagnosed with a rare heart condition in 2020 and the clay has already started to crack. Nick and Pat from West Yorkshire bring in a thermometer that was used to measure extreme temperatures when they lived in the Arctic. The last visitor of the day is Bekki, who brings the remains of an antique glass and lead terrarium that has been completely destroyed after being couriered from Spain to her home after her grandparents died

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc: The five pairs leave Dawson City and head south to the third checkpoint, 2,700km away in Alberta but the stakes are raised as the team who reach the destination last will be eliminated. Race leaders Trisha and Cathie enjoy a 25-hour lead over their nearest competitors but after hiring a car in the last leg they take a risk on car sharing their way to Alberta. Disaster strikes for Monique who injures herself at the checkpoint causing her and father Ladi a further three-hour delay. Zainib and Mobeen formulate a new strategy and Marc has to face his fears. Forty-five hours behind Trisha and Cathie are Claudia and Kevin, sitting in last place with their no-frills strategy

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Highlights of this evening's Premier League fixtures, featuring Manchester United v Brentford at Old Trafford and West Ham United v Newcastle United at London Stadium. United were looking to avenge a 4-0 defeat at the hands of Brentford in August. West Ham held Newcastle to a draw when the teams met two months ago, but both teams were in need of a win this time around for differing reasons. Plus, action from last night's contests, which were Chelsea v Liverpool, Bournemouth v Brighton & Hove Albion, Leeds United v Nottingham Forest and Leicester City v Aston Villa

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: Former world champion boxer Anthony Crolla, sport broadcaster Eilidh Barbour, Commonwealth gold medal winning netballer Eboni Usoro-Brown and Scottish rugby star Adam Hastings join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc: The acerbic chef resumes his search for the country's most exciting and innovative new food and drink business, hand-picking 12 of the UK's best up-and-coming food and drink entrepreneurs to compete to earn an investment - £150,000 of his own money. He starts by inviting the contenders to Glenapp Castle, where he tasks them with creating banquets celebrating his birth-place - Scotland. Will they thrive under pressure or crumble as members of the Edinburgh Royal Military Tattoo, no less, sit down to feast?

programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: A Believer's Guide To
programme.desc: Twenty-three year-old Chiedza converted to Islam three years ago. Now, she is trying to find a husband and has decided to follow traditional and modern Muslim dating rules. She tries a marriage introduction day at a mosque, a Muslim-only dating app and a live dating event with a difference. Will she find love? And will her mother approve?

programme.title: The Moment of Proof
programme.desc: A jacket recovered from a suspect's home has the DNA of not one, but two, stabbing victims on it as police hunt for the person behind a series of seemingly unprovoked attacks. There's little for detectives to go on after a man is left to die in the street and when the attacker strikes again they are in a race against time to find the person responsible. Plus, a fingerprint found on the number plate of the getaway car used in the armed robbery of a neighbourhood pub leads officers to their suspect

programme.title: The Moment of Proof
programme.desc: Fingerprints found at the scene of a burglary are the missing piece of evidence detectives need to convict a man responsible for the murder of the flat owner. When a man is found beaten to death in his own property, police use footprints found around his body to identify one assailant, before putting together their case against his violent accomplice whom they suspect of the killing. Plus, a pair of crooks who burgled an old man and went on a spending spree with his card are caught by CCTV

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick visits Europe's largest tea plantation, on the banks of the River Fal, bakes a simple yet sumptuous fruited tea loaf and travels to Penzande, where he enjoys an invigorating dip in the UK's largest outdoor seawater lido. He also finds out how Cornwall inspired Charles Dickens and how the county found its way into A Christmas Carol

programme.title: Weatherman Walking: The Welsh Coast
programme.desc: Derek Brockway walks from Abersoch to Pwllheli on the Llyn Peninsula, finding some calming beach yoga a good antidote to a testing cliff climb. Derek discovers hoof-prints made in a prehistoric forest millions of years ago, but only recently revealed in shifting sands and stops off at a special retirement village where a little bit of Poland has been recreated in north Wales

programme.desc: The latest headlines, breaking news and sport from the BBC newsroom.

programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win £10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Pubs That Built Britain
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers take a tour of Lincolnshire's pubs, and discover the important roles many of the county's establishments played in the Second World War, from a pub that was used as temporary accommodation for people made homeless by bombing to the Bluebell Inn in Woodhall Spa, which was the local for the pilots of the Dambuster squadron

programme.title: The Big Painting Challenge
programme.desc: Mariella Frostrup and the Rev Richard Coles travel to the Cotswolds, where nine painters work with their professional mentors to conquer techniques to depict nature in all its glory. The first task involves dealing with two subjects that won't stay still - dogs Herbert and Nutmeg - and the final challenge sees them attempting to capture the majesty of the Acer glades

programme.title: My Unique B&B
programme.desc: Simon Parfett and his team head to Epsom Downs in Surrey to help turn a bow-top caravan into a romantic B&B that will be the focal point of Lynn and Mick's wedding business

programme.title: Your Home Made Perfect
programme.desc: A couple living in a Bungalow near Brighton are treated to two virtual reality visions for what their home could become by architects Laura Jane Clark and Robert Jamison. Silvia and Julian bought the property because they loved the garden, and thought they could make something of the house - but their renovations have not been a success. Robert proposes a way to make the planning rules that have restricted them work for the project, while Laura finds a way to bring the beloved garden inside the house. Presented by Angela Scanlon

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: David Harper and Natasha Raskin search for antiques at Watts Gallery in Surrey, and Paul Martin uncovers the story of the ceramicist and designer Mary Watts

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Kemah Bob, JJ Chalmers, Kevin Clifton and Victoria Derbyshire go toe-to-toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week

programme.title: Coast to Coast Food Festival
programme.desc: Edith Bowman and Colin Murray explore the Nairn Show to find tips and treats among the food stalls, including how to spot the perfect egg and how to choose the juiciest berries. Baker Briony-May Williams discovers bargains when using an app designed to reduce food waste, farmer Meinir Howells gets to grips with turning rapeseed into oil in Rhuthin, and chef Suzie Lee finds out whether there's such a thing as a healthy bacon sandwich.

programme.title: Between the Covers
programme.desc: Sara Cox is joined by comedian Sara Pascoe, comedy actor and writer Charlie Higson, singer-songwriter Katie Melua and actor and dancer Adam Garcia, who champion their favourite books. The guests also review this week's two book club choices, which are Strange Sally Diamond by Liz Nugent, and The Summer Book by Tove Jansson

programme.title: Saving Lives at Sea
programme.desc: RNLI volunteers at Calshot on the south coast race to the rescue of a 180-metre-long cargo ship which has run aground on a sandbank, and is now listing at a dangerous angle. At the most northerly lifeboat station on the British mainland, the crew gets called out to investigate a personal locator beacon which has been set off on a remote stretch of rocky coastline, and in Kinsale, volunteers come to the aid of a horse

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: Clive Myrie hosts the fourth semi-final of the quiz, with four returning contenders answering questions on specialist subjects Frank Zappa, the life and works of Siegfried Sassoon, pioneering British & Irish female aviators, and Eurovision Song Contest winners, before facing the general knowledge round

programme.title: University Challenge
programme.desc: Phase two of the quarter-final stage continues, with two teams who lost their first match returning to try to secure the victory they need to stay in contention for a place in the semi-finals. Jeremy Paxman asks the questions

programme.title: Secrets of the Chippendales Murders
programme.desc: The dark side of the all-male stripping troupe, a global phenomenon in the 1980s that was masterminded by an Indian entrepreneur and a children's TV producer. In the first edition, showbusiness beckons when Steve Banerjee leaves India for the bright lights of Los Angeles, purchasing a night club and going into partnership with Nick de Noia

programme.title: Secrets of the Chippendales Murders
programme.desc: How the rise of the Chippendales brought a growing mountain of problems, including the attentions of mobsters, disgruntled dancers, and churchgoers. Meanwhile, Nick De Noia and Steve Banerjee, the two masterminds behind the show, grow obsessed with their fortunes before a shocking murder leaves NYPD detectives at a loss

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories, presented by Kirsty Wark

programme.title: Herself (2020)
programme.desc: After escaping from her abusive husband, Sandra finds herself on a long waiting list for housing. While looking after her two young children and working two part-time jobs, she chances upon a website that, with a little help from friends old and new, changes her life. Drama, starring Clare Dunne and Harriet Walter

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Joe Crowley is in Aberystwyth to meet scientists behind some of the biggest new developments in farming and food security. Charlotte Smith is in the Lea Valley to investigate why what's known as London's Salad Bowl is on the brink of collapse. Adam Henson finds out why the shift towards sustainable farming could mean boom time for native breeds while Adrian Chiles discovers what the future of sheep farming could be in his final report from the Welsh mountains

programme.title: Dragons' Den
programme.desc: A wizard-inspired pair think magical drinks and mini golf will cast a spell over Dragons Peter Jones, Deborah Meaden, Touker Suleyman, Sara Davies and Steven Bartlett. A nervous entrepreneur promotes an all-natural supplement that promises glowing skin from within, while there's a sweet pitch from chocolate-makers who have apparently spotted a gap in the market. Presented by Evan Davis

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Dom Chinea helps artist Jack and potter Jeanet make their passions into money-making businesses. Jack is hoping to swap teaching for creating before it's too late, Dom and mentor Sharon are impressed with his multimedia artwork but are worried that he only seems to use his family as his subjects. University lecturer Jeanet struggles to find time to turn her hobby into a profession but mentor Florian thinks speed and finishing touches are what she needs to make a profit

programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

They sail into Loch Ryan to Scotland's largest oyster bed to discover why they're so special. Chef Julie Lin discovers bargains in the World Food aisles, and gets the lowdown on low fat, semi-skimmed and full fat milk, while farmer Jim Smith gets stuck into some sticky sweets

programme.title: Coastal Defenders
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of commercial diving engineers as they battle time and tide to keep Britain's coastlines and waterways moving. In the first edition, Brighton Marina's main jetty is on the tilt causing chaos for residents and shop owners, so the team devises a plan using air bags to fix it in record time. Young diver Kai reveals how fitness is key to the job they do, and he faces danger when the low tide threatens to bring the concrete jetty down on his head. Craig Parkinson narrates

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Pubs That Built Britain
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers head to Liverpool, where they take a tour of some of the Swinging Sixties most important pubs. They meet John Lennon's drinking buddies from the 1950s to find out what he got up to over a pint or two before he was famous, discover why one pub was a regular for stars including Cilla Black, Gerry and the Pacemakers and the Beatles, and perform on stage at the Cavern Club

programme.title: The Big Painting Challenge
programme.desc: The contestants face a test of their portrait-painting skills at RAF Hendon, and discover the different challenges presented by painting older and younger subjects. programme.title: My Unique B&B
programme.desc: Master craftsman Simon Parfett and his team are in Pembrokeshire to help Toby to create a land-locked submarine from a sonar hull

programme.title: Your Home Made Perfect
programme.desc: Laura Jane Clark and Robert Jamison use virtual reality to redesign a 1930s Surrey house with a poorly designed layout to make better use of the space, and allow the owners to both start a family and have their parents move in with them in the future. Laura's plan involves turning the property into a light-filled interconnected series of spaces, while Robert turns conventional wisdom on its head with a visually striking and flexible design. After experiencing both potential houses, the owners must choose which they would like to put into practice

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin is joined by experts Michael Baggott and Caroline Hawley on a visit to Haddon Hall in Derbyshire, where the team picks out a selection of interesting antiques and collectibles to be sold at a local auction. Michael finds an impressive scent bottle, and Caroline gets a glimpse into the past by looking through a stereoscopic viewer. Paul also looks around the property, and meets the current owner, Lord Edward Manners

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Kemah Bob, JJ Chalmers, Kevin Clifton and Victoria Derbyshire test their general knowledge skills in the hope of winning a prize

programme.title: Coast to Coast Food Festival
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher and Edith Bowman search for tips and treats from food producers during a visit to Leicester Market, including a masterclasses in fajitas and gelato. Ryan Hand discovers why some snacks in the shops seem to be shrinking, Michaela Chiappa reveals what makes a perfect coffee and chef Julie Lin is on a mission to discover the story behind Scotland's square sausages

programme.title: Jay's Yorkshire Workshop
programme.desc: Members of the public nominate local heroes from across Yorkshire to receive bespoke, handmade pieces of wooden furniture to recognise the work they do for their communities, with Jay Blades gives the task of making the items to one of his three experts in his Bradford workshop. First up are a man who donated half his liver to a stranger, care-home workers who moved in to keep residents safe when the pandemic hit and a mum who runs a support group for families with additional needs

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace finds out how Jaffa Cakes are made on a visit to the Manchester factory where McVitie's churn out 1.4 billion of them every year. He follows the process from the delivery of a pre-blended wheat delivery - a pre-blended secret ingredient that gives the cake their light texture - to mixing, baking, jam piping and the addition of the chocolate topping. Away from the factory, historian Ruth Goodman finds out about the historic legal case which saw the company defending their right to call the product a cake and not a biscuit

programme.title: Highland Cops
programme.desc: Documentary about Police Scotland's Highlands and Islands division, revealing what it takes to patrol and keep the peace in one of the most beautiful and challenging places in Britain. in the opening edition, a bushcraft expert is reported missing in remote Sutherland and officers battle to find which route he took in order to locate him before a blizzard sets in. Narrated by James Cosmo

programme.title: Detectorists
programme.desc: Lance has failed to detect even so much as a ring-pull in months, leaving Russell to suspect he has been cursed. Seasonal episode of the comedy from 2015, starring Mackenzie Crook, Toby Jones and Pearce Quigley

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Kirsty Wark

programme.title: Secrets of the Chippendales Murders
programme.desc: The dark side of the all-male stripping troupe, a global phenomenon in the 1980s that was masterminded by an Indian entrepreneur and a children's TV producer

programme.title: Great Australian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels by rail through Queensland from Kuranda to Townsville, marvelling at the engineering expertise of a railway line built in the 1890s. He also visits a plantation where he learns how to harvest sugar cane and ventures into the hinterland, where he braves a crocodile safari

programme.title: A Believer's Guide To
programme.desc: Anish explores his connection to his Hindu faith as an openly gay man. Hoping to reconnect to his religion, he goes on a journey to see if he can reconcile his faith and sexuality. He also faces his greatest fear by revisiting the school where he experienced homophobic bullying as a teenager to speak to the current students about tolerance

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Hobbyist weaver has so far struggled to break into the textile market and mentor Piyush thinks he knows why. Jessica loves colour, but doesn't have a plan of how many she uses in her pieces. Piyush sets her a challenge of using no more than four colours in each of four seasonal collections. Nyanda is a passionate and talented jeweller with a strong design eye, but her business has stalled. Mentor Rachel wants her to make simpler pieces she can produce more quickly and sell for more affordable prices. Presented by Dominic Chinea

programme.title: Saved and Remade
programme.desc: Presenter Sabrina Grant brings her own precious item for the craftspeople to reinvent - a denim collection that belonged to her sister, who died a decade ago. Although Sabrina and her mother have repurposed and reused a lot of her sister's things, the box of denim has been hidden away. Designer and fabric expert Chinelo wants to create something beautiful for Sabrina's mum and for Sabrina too as a celebration of her sister's memory

programme.title: Saved and Remade
programme.desc: A special recumbent tricycle that once carried an Olympic torch is restored, and a widow's wish for her wedding and engagement rings comes trues. Presented by Sabrina Grant

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Steve Brown is with a pair of cycling enthusiasts on the hunt for a rural idyll in the Peak District, and also visits one of the country's best destinations for accessible fishing

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Nigel Havers presents as five sets of sellers bring their items to the Bidding Room. The dealers bid for a set of wooden gym lockers from the 1970s, a Chinese fruit yoke, a gold mirror, a pair of bronze busts of Princess Margaret and Queen Elizabeth as children and a mechanical sheep shearer

programme.title: See Hear
programme.desc: Weekly magazine for the deaf and hard of hearing. With voiceover

programme.title: 24/7 Pet Hospital
programme.desc: Cameras follow daily events at a Co Durham pet hospital, as its specialist vets and staff attend the needs of animals 24 hours each day. A rescue kitten is having trouble walking, so the team investigates why. A French Bulldog is in labour, while a Labrador puppy finds out whether his operation has been a success. Narrated by Kieran Bew

programme.title: BBC News at 9
programme.desc: The latest headlines, breaking news and sport from the BBC newsroom.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win £10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Pubs That Built Britain
programme.desc: Dave heads to the valleys of south Wales, where he uncovers the history of various establishments and unearths pubs that were at the heart of the area's coal mining communities. Along the way, he journeys underground to the coal face to find out what life was like, meets an award-winning choir, and drives a steam train with a pub at the end of its line

programme.title: The Big Painting Challenge
programme.desc: The seven remaining artists are challenged to show off their waterscape painting skills during a visit to Loch Lomond. Firstly, they must paint a boat on the water during a particularly windy day, before creating a panoramic view of the entire lake. They also receive a masterclass on mixing colours before local members of the public choose a favourite to go through to the semi-final

programme.title: My Unique B&B
programme.desc: Master craftsman Simon Parfett and his team travel to Somerset where owners Sue, David and Katie have asked for help to create a fairytale treehouse

programme.title: Your Home Made Perfect
programme.desc: Architects Laura Jane Clark and Robert Jamison come up with virtual reality designs to transform a Halifax couple's 19th-century home. When owner Paula developed MS, it became vital to make the house more wheelchair accessible - but her partner Jeremy also sees an opportunity to give it a stylish new look. Laura's concept makes the most of the views of the garden and uses clever recycling tricks to stretch the budget, while Robert deploys off-the-shelf materials to making the place more accessible

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin revisits some of the historic venues from the series' history. He also finds out about the scandalous Georgians of Lydiard Park

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Kemah Bob, JJ Chalmers, Kevin Clifton and Victoria Derbyshire test their general knowledge skills in the hope of winning a prize

programme.title: Coast to Coast Food Festival
programme.desc: Colin Murray and Edith Bowman discover tips and treats at the food and music festival in Newcastle. They find out how to create award-winning burgers and reveal the secrets of chips, French-Canadian style. Briony-May Williams goes on the trail of the nation's favourite herb and chef Julie Lin sets sail to find Scotland's most valuable fish. Farmer Meinir Howells investigates the growing popularity of keeping chickens

programme.title: Jay's Yorkshire Workshop
programme.desc: Angie, a matron at Airedale General Hospital in West Yorkshire, nominates primary school St Anne's in Keighley. During lockdown, children from the school fundraised for the hospital, raising more than 10 times their initial £200 target by taking part in sponsored exercise. Jay Blades then travels to Hebden Bridge in the Calder Valley - an area that has suffered from heavy flooding and damage in the past few years. Here, he meets local resident Karen, who wants to nominate Trevor, a volunteer flood warden who has helped Karen and other local residents when their homes have been devastated

programme.title: Rebuilding Notre-Dame
programme.desc: In a programme first shown 12 months ago, Lucy Worsley is given access to the cathedral in Paris at a critical point in the restoration, as building work is being ramped up in a bid to meet the ambitious deadline to reopen it to the public in 2024. Lucy meets scientists, historians and craftspeople working to return the 850-year-old Gothic masterpiece to its former glory. The fire coated Notre-Dame with tons of toxic lead dust, so specialists are now decontaminating the site

programme.title: Saving Lives in Leeds
programme.desc: Kostas Papagiannopoulos's surgical list includes 79-year-old Barry, who has a suspicious growth on his lung. Previous attempts to diagnose it have failed, so Kostas uses keyhole surgery to remove a section of lung before sending it off for immediate analysis, waiting in theatre in case he has to proceed further. Meanwhile, Andrew Hogarth treats 52-year-old Roger, who has been on the cardiac ward for a week with a life-threatening infection

programme.title: The Cockfields
programme.desc: Sunday finds preparations for Simon's 40th birthday in full swing - amid much stress levels. Larry arrives with a very hungover Melissa, who immediately disrupts proceedings. After an awkward lunch it's present time and Larry gives Simon a red leather jacket which, to Ray's delight, looks ridiculous on him. Eventually Melissa joins the party, but rejects Sue's food. Simon tries to defend his father's behaviour to Ray and an argument ensues until David drops a bombshell that makes Simon's birthday one he'll never forget. Comedy, starring Joe Wilkinson, Diane Morgan, Sue Johnston and Bobby Ball

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Victoria Derbyshire

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Secrets of the Chippendales Murders
programme.desc: How the rise of the dance troupe brought a growing mountain of problems, including the attention of mobsters, disgruntled dancers and churchgoers. Nick De Noia and Steve Banerjee, the two masterminds behind the show, quickly grew obsessed with their fortunes - until a shocking murder which left NYPD detectives at a loss

programme.title: See Hear
programme.desc: Weekly magazine for the deaf and hard of hearing. With voiceover

programme.title: Amanda & Alan's Italian Job
programme.desc: Amanda Holden aims to bring a slice of Hollywood to Sicily with a banana leaf-patterned boudoir as she takes the reins designing the master bedroom. Alan Carr is concerned her camp theme is on the wrong side of tacky, so she takes him to visit one of Palermo's most prestigious hotels to show how exuberant décor has enticed high-profile guests including famous composer Richard Wagner. To bring her vision to life, Amanda ropes in her DIY-loving father to help build a bespoke four-poster bed. Alan, meanwhile, learns to kick back like the Italians do, with a lesson in the art of doing nothing

programme.title: Saving Lives in Leeds
programme.desc: Documentary following doctors and surgeons working for Leeds Hospitals Trust as they decide who to treat next on their ever-increasing waiting lists. At Leeds General Infirmary, Professor Simon Kay stands ready to perform a rare double hand transplant, while in neurosurgery Kenan Deniz has two patients needing urgent brain operations

programme.title: Becoming Frida Kahlo
programme.desc: Documentary charting the life and career of the Mexican artist, beginning with her early years when a young Frida grew up in a time of revolution. The programme looks at her rebellious schooldays and a fateful encounter with Diego Rivera, then one of the world's most famous artists and the man who would change her life

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues exploring Hong Kong, riding the MTR metro system and talking to people involved in the current political protests. He learns about Sun Yat Sen, the first president of the Republic of China, who studied medicine in Hong Kong, and in one of the walled villages of the New Territories, he meets a descendant of one of the region's oldest dynasties

programme.title: Canal Boat Diaries
programme.desc: On the last leg of his epic journey across the north of England, narrowboater Robbie Cumming tackles the fast-flowing River Ouse and is forced to make an emergency stop. His destination is Ripon Basin at the outer reaches of Britain's inland waterways.

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.desc: Alice Roberts heads to the south of England to see the rich pickings on offer, including the earliest money made in Britain and a massive haul of Roman treasure that brings to life the fall of the empire in Britain

programme.title: Britain's Lost Masterpieces
programme.desc: Jacky Klein and Dr Bendor Grosvenor visit Belfast to take in the Ulster Museum, and assess what are thought to be low-value copies of works by Peter Breughel the Younger. They also head to the Northern Ireland Assembly at Stormont, where they view a controversial image. Said to depict William III and the Pope, the painting was once slashed with a knife, and is now kept in a room away from public view

programme.title: Endgame in Ireland
programme.desc: Examining the peace process in Northern Ireland, beginning with a look back to 1981, when an IRA prisoner won a Westminster by-election, followed by the election of Sinn Fein's Gerry Adams in 1983. The programme includes first-hand accounts by all the key politicians and parliamentary leaders, including Margaret Thatcher who describes what happened when the Brighton bomb exploded in 1984

programme.title: Sword, Musket & Machine Gun: Britain's Armed History
programme.desc: Dr Sam Willis charts the evolution of weaponry in Britain from 1800 to the First World War, looking at the drive to develop ever-more precise weapons, from artillery shells and rifles to the Maxim machine gun. Sam test-fires a Brown Bess musket, the infantry weapon of choice at Waterloo in 1815 and looks at efforts to make artillery more effective on the battlefield with the invention of 'spherical case shot', a new type of shell that was named after its inventor - Henry Shrapnel

programme.title: A Pembrokeshire Farm
programme.desc: As summer arrives, the farmhouse is stripped down to its bare essentials, and Griff Rhys Jones meets geologist Sid Howells to explore what secrets the nearby rocks are holding

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.desc: Alice Roberts heads to the south of England to see the rich pickings on offer, including the earliest money made in Britain and a massive haul of Roman treasure that brings to life the fall of the empire in Britain

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues exploring Hong Kong, riding the MTR metro system and talking to people involved in the current political protests. He learns about Sun Yat Sen, the first president of the Republic of China, who studied medicine in Hong Kong, and in one of the walled villages of the New Territories, he meets a descendant of one of the region's oldest dynasties

programme.title: Canal Boat Diaries
programme.desc: On the last leg of his epic journey across the north of England, narrowboater Robbie Cumming tackles the fast-flowing River Ouse and is forced to make an emergency stop. His destination is Ripon Basin at the outer reaches of Britain's inland waterways.

programme.title: Britain's Lost Masterpieces
programme.desc: Jacky Klein and Dr Bendor Grosvenor visit Belfast to take in the Ulster Museum, and assess what are thought to be low-value copies of works by Peter Breughel the Younger. They also head to the Northern Ireland Assembly at Stormont, where they view a controversial image. Said to depict William III and the Pope, the painting was once slashed with a knife, and is now kept in a room away from public view

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: On this leg of his trip in Thailand, Michael Portillo tries his hand at the art of umbrella-making and learns about northern Thai cookery. He explores the walled and moated city of Chiang Mai, former capital of the Lanna Kingdom before it was annexed by the King of Siam. Travelling south to Lampang, he discovers the former centre of the teak wood business and investigates how successive Thai kings preserved their independence from the rival colonial powers of Britain and France

programme.title: Canals: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc: Liz McIvor tells the story of the people who operated the canal boats, carrying fuel and goods around the country. During the Victorian era they gained reputations for criminality, violence and drinking, but was such a reputation deserved? Liz discovers grisly canal crimes, investigates health and welfare on-board working boats, and looks at why canal children were last on the list to be offered safeguards and formal education. She reveals the campaigners who set out to tackle this injustice, including George Smith of Coalville, Leicestershire, and Sister Mary Ward of Stoke Bruerne, Northamptonshire

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Judith goes away for the weekend, leaving Lionel and Jean with the house to themselves. Comedy about late-blossoming love, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer

programme.title: Whatever Happened to the Likely Lads?
programme.desc: First episode of the classic comedy sequel. Bob travels down to London in his efforts to find a suitable wedding present, where fate sees him reunited with Terry, returning home after a gruelling spell in the Army. Starring Rodney Bewes and James Bolam. From 1973

programme.title: A History of Britain by Simon Schama
programme.desc: The historian investigates the changing role of women in the Victorian era, looking at the work of novelist Elizabeth Gaskell, whose fiction highlighted the plight of needy factory workers. Simon also examines the ground-breaking efforts of doctor Elizabeth Garrett Anderson, health campaigner Mary Seacole and political activists Harriet Stuart Mill and Annie Besant

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: Documentary telling the dramatic story of the devastating fire at the Paris cathedral on April 15, 2019, following the firefighters who faced the responsibility of saving one of the city's most emblematic and much-loved symbols from burning to the ground

programme.title: Restoring the Earth: The Age of Nature
programme.desc: Exploring the connections within and between ecosystems, looking at how planting trees can reverse the impact of deforestation, help native wildlife to thrive and aid in mitigating the effects of climate change. The programme also examines the complexity within every ecosystem and shows how the wrong species in the wrong place can have catastrophic effects

programme.title: A Pembrokeshire Farm
programme.desc: Building work moves to the inside of Griff Rhys Jones' house, and things are at last being built up instead of knocked down, but as the deadline approaches, tempers begin to fray

programme.title: How to Make
programme.desc: Designer Zoe Laughlin sets out to redesign audio headphones, an intimate item that transport the wearer to another place. In search of inspiration she heads to Hull University to discover a new substance that can turn any surface into a speaker - from a wall to a table and even the bone of a skull. Zoe also looks at the device's history, from the stethoscope-style home contraptions of the 19th century and the game-changing 1980s Sony Walkman. But what will she come up with in her own design?

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: On this leg of his trip in Thailand, Michael Portillo tries his hand at the art of umbrella-making and learns about northern Thai cookery. He explores the walled and moated city of Chiang Mai, former capital of the Lanna Kingdom before it was annexed by the King of Siam. Travelling south to Lampang, he discovers the former centre of the teak wood business and investigates how successive Thai kings preserved their independence from the rival colonial powers of Britain and France

programme.title: Canals: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc: Liz McIvor tells the story of the people who operated the canal boats, carrying fuel and goods around the country. During the Victorian era they gained reputations for criminality, violence and drinking, but was such a reputation deserved? Liz discovers grisly canal crimes, investigates health and welfare on-board working boats, and looks at why canal children were last on the list to be offered safeguards and formal education. She reveals the campaigners who set out to tackle this injustice, including George Smith of Coalville, Leicestershire, and Sister Mary Ward of Stoke Bruerne, Northamptonshire

programme.title: A History of Britain by Simon Schama
programme.desc: The historian investigates the changing role of women in the Victorian era, looking at the work of novelist Elizabeth Gaskell, whose fiction highlighted the plight of needy factory workers. Simon also examines the ground-breaking efforts of doctor Elizabeth Garrett Anderson, health campaigner Mary Seacole and political activists Harriet Stuart Mill and Annie Besant

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo journeys through Thailand, stopping to help at a hospital for elephants wounded by landmines and visiting ruined temples in the former Siamese capital of Ayutthaya

programme.title: Canals: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc: Liz McIvor examines the Manchester Ship Canal, hailed as the greatest engineering feat of the Victorian age. Widely regarded as troublesome outsiders who led a drunken life of ungodly debauchery, the navvies who built it toiled in a time of rising trade unionism, prompting Liz to consider how well they managed to organise themselves in campaigning for the best possible deal

programme.title: Wonders of the Great Barrier Reef with Iolo Williams
programme.desc: The naturalist travels with a specialist dive team looking for signs of hope that the Great Barrier Reef can survive the threat of global warming. Invited on the journey by award-winning underwater cinematographer and marine biologist Richard Fitzpatrick, Iolo dives deep beneath the tranquil surface of the coral sea to discover what state this natural wonder is in

programme.title: The Fairytale Castles of King Ludwig II with Dan Cruickshank
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the aesthetic styles associated with Ludwig II of Bavaria, the king who was considered to be handsome and loved by his people. Dan Cruickshank investigates the mock-medievalism of Neuschwanstein castle and the complex design of Herrenchiemsee, to assess how they are key to learning more about the enigmatic ruler

programme.title: Elizabeth R
programme.desc: The queen meets an interesting suitor, the Duke of Anjou, much to the Puritans' disapproval. Now she must decide whether to follow her head or her heart. Award-winning drama chronicling the reign of Elizabeth I, starring Glenda Jackson, Ronald Hines, Robert Hardy, Stephen Murray and Bernard Horsfall

programme.title: Elizabeth R
programme.desc: The monarch's position is increasingly threatened by the imprisoned Mary, Queen of Scots and her loyal supporters, leaving Elizabeth to ponder Mary's fate. Starring Glenda Jackson, Vivian Pickles, David Collings and Stephen Murray

programme.title: Julius Caesar Revealed
programme.desc: Mary Beard sets out on a quest to uncover the real Julius Caesar, challenging the received popular view of the Roman politician and general. The classicist looks at how he become the autocratic ruler of Rome, the tactics of his military campaigns, his use of spin and PR on his way to the top, and the reasons behind his assassination on the Ides of March in 44 BC. The scholar also examines his surprising legacy right up to the present day, revealing how his influence is still shaping language, politics and people's everyday lives

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo journeys through Thailand, stopping to help at a hospital for elephants wounded by landmines and visiting ruined temples in the former Siamese capital of Ayutthaya

programme.title: Canals: The Making of a Nation

Widely regarded as troublesome outsiders who led a drunken life of ungodly debauchery, the navvies who built it toiled in a time of rising trade unionism, prompting Liz to consider how well they managed to organise themselves in campaigning for the best possible deal

Invited on the journey by award-winning underwater cinematographer and marine biologist Richard Fitzpatrick, Iolo dives deep beneath the tranquil surface of the coral sea to discover what state this natural wonder is in

programme.title: Shaun the Sheep
programme.desc: A bored Shaun dresses up as the farmer to entertain the flock, and throws a party after realising he now has the power to boss Bitzer around. However, Shaun is soon confronted by the real farmer

programme.title: Danger Mouse
programme.desc: The Baron releases a new strain of elephant flu and it is down to DM and Penfold to find the cure before everyone in the world is turned into a snotty creature

programme.title: Dennis & Gnasher Unleashed!
programme.desc: On the first day of a new school year, Dennis and the gang imagine all the things that might be new and unfamiliar at Bash Street School. By the time they reach the front gates, they are all expecting the worst.

programme.title: Boy Girl Dog Cat Mouse Cheese
programme.desc: Gramps gets an offer to leave town for a whole year to go on an adventurous trek, but the kids would miss him and try to convince him to stay.

programme.title: Newsround
programme.desc: Topical news magazine for children.

programme.title: Ninja Express
programme.desc: With their juice bar empty, a grandma and granddaughter ask the Ninjas for a mariachi band to entice customers - but Konpeki’s trumpet playing threatens the delivery.

programme.title: Danny & Mick
programme.desc: Through an accident at the leisure centre, Danny and Mick discover what they think is a treasure map. The hunt is on to follow the golden route, but they end up digging their way into trouble!

programme.title: Odd Squad
programme.desc: Two of Ms O's assistants accidentally find themselves on a mission

programme.title: Pokemon
programme.desc: Ash and the others meet a superstar Magikarp at a TV station, but Ash can't help but notice there's something odd about her.

programme.title: Pokemon
programme.desc: Trainers with Z-Crystals are being attacked by an Ultra Beast, and the only eye witness is the unreliable Meowth.

programme.title: Taffy
programme.desc: Bentley and Taffy are off on their holidays! Forsythe has promised Mrs Muchmore that they will leave at exactly noon and definitely won’t be late. Bentley thinks this is the perfect time to take Taffy for a walk in the garden’s maze.

programme.title: Oswaldo
programme.desc: Oswaldo goes to a video game rental place for the first time.

programme.title: Monster Loving Maniacs
programme.desc: Three monster-loving kids visit their grandfather in the most haunted city on earth.

programme.title: Monster Loving Maniacs
programme.desc: Edith and Bo decide to stay and fulfil their destiny, but Ernest has serious doubts.

programme.title: Deadly Predators
programme.desc: Steve Backshall explores the world of predators, beginning with looking at how sharks use super-sensing electro reception to detect prey hidden on the bottom of the ocean

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: The Saxon gods form an unlikely team of superheroes, famous astronaut Neil Armstrong reveals his new weight loss programme, Georgian London's crime-fighting genius is revealed, and Rosa Parks sings about her struggle for equality

programme.title: The Next Step
programme.desc: The nationals are back on, but it will only be one of A-troupe or B-troupe attending. Reality-style drama, following the lives of a group of dancers

programme.title: The Next Step
programme.desc: A TNS legend suggests a controversial solution to the nationals dilemma. Reality-style drama, following the lives of a group of dancers

programme.title: The Next Step
programme.desc: Young, talented and hungry dancers show up for the challenge, but as Cleo helps Nick, she resolves to give up her spot as dance captain and audition just like the rest of her old teammates. Meanwhile, Richelle, Piper, Amy, Finn and Kingston go to a Radiation performance, where Finn finds his new obsession

programme.title: Danger Mouse
programme.desc: DM is forced to choose between dedication to duty and friendship when he battles the Baron in his evil underwater Toadlantis base

programme.title: Danger Mouse
programme.desc: Danger Mouse's attempts at gardening lead to a gigantic Welsh space plant taking over the world and an attack of intergalactic bees. Only Penfold's jam obsession can save the day

programme.title: Boy Girl Dog Cat Mouse Cheese
programme.desc: The kids watch a scary old horror movie where a character speaks a certain ancient-language phrase meant to curse the victims to the shadow realm. The movie scares some of the kids, but Girl calls it all a bunch of hocus-pocus and speaks the phrase aloud herself. One by one, the siblings start disappearing, leaving only a superstitious Boy

programme.title: Boy Girl Dog Cat Mouse Cheese
programme.desc: Everybody gets jealous when Boy bakes amazing cookies that he only shares with his new pen pal, Gretchen. They band together and pretend to be Gretchen, writing letters to Boy and asking him to send more cookies, which they then intercept and eat for themselves. However, when Boy asks to meet Gretchen in person, Girl, Dog, Cat, Mouse and Cheese come up with a plan to impersonate her and steal Boy's cookie recipe once and for all

programme.title: Dennis & Gnasher Unleashed!
programme.desc: Pieface secretly does chores for Walter

programme.title: Matilda and the Ramsay Bunch
programme.desc: Cookery show following 13-year-old Matilda Ramsay, daughter of renowned chef Gordon, as the family heads to LA for an unforgettable summer and the youngster cooks her way through the very best of US and British dishes - all with her unique twists. In the first edition, the family members arrive in California, where they visit the famous Hollywood sign, and Matilda cooks burgers with smoky fries, followed by her ice cream Ramsay Whoopies

programme.title: Matilda and the Ramsay Bunch
programme.desc: The family members visit one of Hollywood's leading stunt schools and learn how to make their own action films. Armed with their new skills, they put together their own movies. Matilda creates food for their own awards ceremony, including a secret dish served in a paper envelope and opened at the table, baked potatoes dressed up with sour cream and Matilda Awards Biscuits as prizes for the best action film

programme.title: Matilda and the Ramsay Bunch
programme.desc: Matilda Ramsay creates food for a monster-themed party, featuring a menu with severed hands, gory goblin heads and bloodied cakes. The rest of the family members get into the mood with a trip to a special effects studio, where they have some frightening make-up applied, and they also find out how to levitate

programme.title: Truckers: Life on the Road
programme.desc: Tramper Tigger tests her reversing skills to the limit, and receptionist Jess gets a go behind the wheel when operations director Doug gives her a lesson. Long-time trucker Andy is trained to transport heavy loads of steel. After a 3am start, he's picking up from a titan of the Welsh economy - Tata Steel in Port Talbot, where massive furnaces burn throughout the day and night

programme.title: Iolo's Borderlands
programme.desc: Iolo Williams explores Monmouthshire, looks for a rare bee on the Gwent Levels and finds fallow deer in the Wye Valley, as well as a heavily camouflaged bird near Abergavenny. Iolo ends this portion of his journey at Llanthony Priory, where house martins are nesting in the ruins

programme.title: Blue Lights
programme.desc: The team scrambles to deal with a series of mysterious emergencies across the city, all stemming from a bad batch of drugs. The McIntyre gang soon realise the crisis can be traced back to one of their young drug runners, has been selling drugs outside of their area, so race to cover their tracks. Annie receives terrifying news that has her wondering who she can trust even within her own community

programme.title: Charlotte in Sunderland
programme.desc: Tensions are high at dinner with Charlotte's parents as she's gone way over budget for the fashion show. Jake has finally moved into the Crosby Manor, but there's little time to waste as they head to York Fashion Week

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Things go from bad to worse for Freddie and Nugget's in trouble for taking Jordan to Denzel's party. Denise reveals all her secrets to an enraged Kim and Jack and Amy comfort Howie as he worries for Denzel

programme.title: Interior Design Masters
programme.desc: The designers each have two days, a painter, a carpenter and £1,000 to transform a 1930s beach chalet to fit their different briefs. Peter is determined to put being in the bottom four behind him with a big and bold design for his family bolthole chalet and Tom supresses his instincts for cosy chic as he takes on a Caribbean-themed shack. Monika steps out of her usual gothic comfort zone to design a home for a group of friends called The Gin Club and Temi takes on a different approach for her eco-chalet. Jack takes his brief for a team building space for A&E staff as an opportunity to give back to the NHS staff that saved his life. Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen joins as a guest judge

programme.title: Anton & Giovanni's Adventures in Sicily
programme.desc: The pair make their way through the centre of the island in the final leg of their trip where they try their hands at pasta-making and synchronised swimming before heading to the outskirts of Palermo where Giovanni has lined up an overnight stay with a group of beer-brewing monks. Finally, they head into Palermo where Anton meets Giovanni's parents and unveils a surprise birthday present

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Rain Dogs
programme.desc: A dysfunctional family attempt to go straight in a crooked world. After being kicked out of their apartment, Costello and Iris try to find housing before nightfall. Selby is back after a stint in prison and keen to connect with the pair. Costello and Selby don't know if they can trust each other, but as their search for a place to stay grows more desperate, they both stop at nothing to keep Iris safe

programme.title: Safe Haven (2013)
programme.desc: A mysterious woman arrives in a small coastal town looking to make a fresh start, but seems reluctant to discuss her past. As she forms a close friendship with a neighbour and falls for a single father, she begins to realise the time has come to confront the dark secrets she is fleeing from. Romantic drama based on Nicholas Sparks' novel, with Julianne Hough, Josh Duhamel and Cobie Smulders

programme.title: Virtually Home
programme.desc: A couple cannot agree what to do with their Norfolk living room and snug area, so Russell Sage comes up with two virtual reality designs to help settle their differences

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin makes his way to Lincolnshire to assist a pair of expats who have a £300,000 budget to make the big return home after 11 years living abroad in Cyprus. Whilst in one of the country's largest agricultural counties, Jonnie also pays a visit to a land-based college to find out about the changing face of farming practices with the next generation of farmers

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Nigel Havers hosts at five sets of sellers bring their precious items to the Bidding Room. The dealers bid for a pair of cherub wall lights, a collection of miniature Ferrari cars, an early 1900's brass microscope, a pair of carved mirrors and a light up grocer's sign

programme.title: Unbeatable
programme.desc: Jason Manford presents the general knowledge quiz in which four contestants compete over three rounds to find a single 'unbeatable' answer and streak ahead of the rest to make the final where they can win a cash prize

programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Party Election Broadcast
programme.desc: By the Labour Party

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Emma Willis and Jermaine Jenas host the magazine show, with stories of interest from around the UK, plus celebrity guests in the studio

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Kim and Denise try to break up Ravi and Chelsea, but Ravi has other plans. Callum receives an urgent work call that changes things for the people on the square and Freddie confronts his old teacher

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and his team of experts welcome Rokeya and Patricia into the Repair Shop who have brought in a painting that has been in their family since it was commissioned in the early 1950s. Kirsten Ramsay takes on the challenge of repairing a clay keepsake of Emese and Luke's son's footprints. David, who died at just five months old, was diagnosed with a rare heart condition in 2020 and the clay has already started to crack. Nick and Pat from West Yorkshire bring in a thermometer that was used to measure extreme temperatures when they lived in the Arctic. The last visitor of the day is Bekki, who brings the remains of an antique glass and lead terrarium that has been completely destroyed after being couriered from Spain to her home after her grandparents died

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc: The five pairs leave Dawson City and head south to the third checkpoint, 2,700km away in Alberta but the stakes are raised as the team who reach the destination last will be eliminated. Race leaders Trisha and Cathie enjoy a 25-hour lead over their nearest competitors but after hiring a car in the last leg they take a risk on car sharing their way to Alberta. Disaster strikes for Monique who injures herself at the checkpoint causing her and father Ladi a further three-hour delay. Zainib and Mobeen formulate a new strategy and Marc has to face his fears. Forty-five hours behind Trisha and Cathie are Claudia and Kevin, sitting in last place with their no-frills strategy

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Highlights of this evening's Premier League fixtures, featuring Manchester United v Brentford at Old Trafford and West Ham United v Newcastle United at London Stadium. United were looking to avenge a 4-0 defeat at the hands of Brentford in August. West Ham held Newcastle to a draw when the teams met two months ago, but both teams were in need of a win this time around for differing reasons. Plus, action from last night's contests, which were Chelsea v Liverpool, Bournemouth v Brighton & Hove Albion, Leeds United v Nottingham Forest and Leicester City v Aston Villa

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: Former world champion boxer Anthony Crolla, sport broadcaster Eilidh Barbour, Commonwealth gold medal winning netballer Eboni Usoro-Brown and Scottish rugby star Adam Hastings join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc: The acerbic chef resumes his search for the country's most exciting and innovative new food and drink business, hand-picking 12 of the UK's best up-and-coming food and drink entrepreneurs to compete to earn an investment - £150,000 of his own money. He starts by inviting the contenders to Glenapp Castle, where he tasks them with creating banquets celebrating his birth-place - Scotland. Will they thrive under pressure or crumble as members of the Edinburgh Royal Military Tattoo, no less, sit down to feast?

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Kim and Denise try to break up Ravi and Chelsea, but Ravi has other plans. Callum receives an urgent work call that changes things for the people on the square and Freddie confronts his old teacher

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and his team of experts welcome Rokeya and Patricia into the Repair Shop who have brought in a painting that has been in their family since it was commissioned in the early 1950s. Kirsten Ramsay takes on the challenge of repairing a clay keepsake of Emese and Luke's son's footprints. David, who died at just five months old, was diagnosed with a rare heart condition in 2020 and the clay has already started to crack. Nick and Pat from West Yorkshire bring in a thermometer that was used to measure extreme temperatures when they lived in the Arctic. The last visitor of the day is Bekki, who brings the remains of an antique glass and lead terrarium that has been completely destroyed after being couriered from Spain to her home after her grandparents died

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc: The five pairs leave Dawson City and head south to the third checkpoint, 2,700km away in Alberta but the stakes are raised as the team who reach the destination last will be eliminated. Race leaders Trisha and Cathie enjoy a 25-hour lead over their nearest competitors but after hiring a car in the last leg they take a risk on car sharing their way to Alberta. Disaster strikes for Monique who injures herself at the checkpoint causing her and father Ladi a further three-hour delay. Zainib and Mobeen formulate a new strategy and Marc has to face his fears. Forty-five hours behind Trisha and Cathie are Claudia and Kevin, sitting in last place with their no-frills strategy

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Highlights of this evening's Premier League fixtures, featuring Manchester United v Brentford at Old Trafford and West Ham United v Newcastle United at London Stadium. United were looking to avenge a 4-0 defeat at the hands of Brentford in August. West Ham held Newcastle to a draw when the teams met two months ago, but both teams were in need of a win this time around for differing reasons. Plus, action from last night's contests, which were Chelsea v Liverpool, Bournemouth v Brighton & Hove Albion, Leeds United v Nottingham Forest and Leicester City v Aston Villa

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: Former world champion boxer Anthony Crolla, sport broadcaster Eilidh Barbour, Commonwealth gold medal winning netballer Eboni Usoro-Brown and Scottish rugby star Adam Hastings join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc: The acerbic chef resumes his search for the country's most exciting and innovative new food and drink business, hand-picking 12 of the UK's best up-and-coming food and drink entrepreneurs to compete to earn an investment - £150,000 of his own money. He starts by inviting the contenders to Glenapp Castle, where he tasks them with creating banquets celebrating his birth-place - Scotland. Will they thrive under pressure or crumble as members of the Edinburgh Royal Military Tattoo, no less, sit down to feast?

programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Kym Marsh and Gethin Jones host the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: The Moment of Proof
programme.desc: Blood spatters found on a trench coat link a callous killer to the murder of a wealthy pensioner. Also, a detective proves a crashed airplane was too heavy for take-off

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Ben Fogle helps keepers discover whether their macaque monkeys will use sticks as tools, while wildlife photographer Hamza Yassin helps with the annual survey of heron numbers

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Dion Dublin, Martel Maxwell and Tommy Walsh visit three properties about to be auctioned in the West Midlands city of Coventry, and the Kent towns of Folkestone and Maidstone

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion and the teams shop for antiques in Nottinghamshire with experts Philip Serrell and Roo Irvine. Christina also learns about the author of The Complete Angler

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Suni helps a troubled young footballer deal with a new challenge, while going through some life changing moments himself

programme.title: Virtually Home
programme.desc: People with interior design dilemmas are offered a helping hand by some of the UK's leading interior designers, alongside the use of some cutting-edge virtual reality technology. The first episode features two friends in Skipton, Yorkshire, who call on Karen Livingstone Welstead for advice on how to redesign their awkward cellar space

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Steve Brown is with a pair of cycling enthusiasts on the hunt for a rural idyll in the Peak District, and also visits one of the country's best destinations for accessible fishing

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Nigel Havers hosts as five dealers battle each other to buy items brought in by the public. Nigel meets a fellow Nigel who for the last 30 years has owned a £20 note that is missing the Queen's head. Verified as being a genuine printing error by the Bank of England, its value is uncertain. Other items presented include a silver bowl made by the White Starline who equipped the Titanic and a '70s poster for a West End production of The King and I

programme.title: Unbeatable
programme.desc: Over three rounds, contestants vie to find the single 'unbeatable' answer and streak ahead of the rest to make the final where they can win a cash prize. General knowledge quiz, hosted by Jason Manford

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong is joined by co-host Ed Gamble for the quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious answers

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Emma Willis and Jermaine Jenas are at the helm for the first visit of the week to the One Show studio, featuring the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Kim receives an Influencer of the Moment award while Denzel hosts a secret party at home. Denise is infuriated when Chelsea and Ravi start to grow closer but Stacey's warning plays on Chelsea's mind. Freddie finds himself double booked with two different dates scheduled for the same evening

programme.title: The Drug Wars that Killed Olivia
programme.desc: Bronagh Munro investigates the drug market in Liverpool and how Olivia Pratt-Korbel became the youngest of dozens of victims to the gang wars

programme.title: Blue Lights
programme.desc: The team scrambles to deal with a series of mysterious emergencies across the city, all stemming from a bad batch of drugs. The McIntyre gang soon realise the crisis can be traced back to one of their young drug runners, has been selling drugs outside of their area, so race to cover their tracks. Annie receives terrifying news that has her wondering who she can trust even within her own community

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: The House of Paisley
programme.desc: A profile of the Rev Ian Paisley, and his often controversial career. The founder of his own church, Paisley gathered converts who viewed him as a prophet, preaching against the temptations of alcohol, gambling and the Catholic Church

programme.title: Project Icon: The UK's Next Music Star
programme.desc: The artists must master the art of collaboration to avoid a double elimination. Working together in groups, they will be taking on two of Becky Hill's most famous tracks. At the end of the challenge, three singers go head to head to save their place in the competition and only six of them will remain

programme.title: Charlotte in Sunderland
programme.desc: Tensions are high at dinner with Charlotte's parents as she's gone way over budget for the fashion show. Jake has finally moved into the Crosby Manor, but there's little time to waste as they head to York Fashion Week

programme.title: Charlotte in Sunderland
programme.desc: Charlotte breaks the news of her mother's illness to her best friend Lauren. Jake and Gary bond over a pint and open up about their hopes and fears for the future. Jade and Charlotte get ready for a romantic date night, but emotions overwhelm the new couple as they reflect on everything going on in their new family

programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: The Moment of Proof
programme.desc: Traces of blood on a shirt leads to the conviction of a murderer. Meanwhile, detectives are left baffled by a motive-less killing. Plus a rapper tells tales on himself in his songs

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Native beavers appear to have returned to the park, and it's time to check in with the fennec foxes to see if love has blossomed between Anthony and Zuri

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts and the team explore two unusual properties about to be auctioned in Kent and Yorkshire, plus a large Victorian end terrace in Greater Manchester

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross presents the show from Hele, near Exeter, and demonstrates a mysterious Victorian gadget. Experts Caroline Hawley and John Cameron assist the teams

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Imogen worries about Rob as everyone tries to process their grief, Ollie finds himself stuck in the middle

programme.title: Virtually Home
programme.desc: A couple from Huntingdon, Cambridgeshire, call on the help of interior designer Kunal Trehan to inject some life into their blank canvas of a living room

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton helps a couple looking for a complete lifestyle change in the Cumbrian countryside. A relocation driven by a desire to be closer to their daughter

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Nigel Havers presents as five sets of sellers bring their items to the Bidding Room. The dealers bid for a set of wooden gym lockers from the 1970s, a Chinese fruit yoke, a gold mirror, a pair of bronze busts of Princess Margaret and Queen Elizabeth as children and a mechanical sheep shearer

programme.title: Unbeatable

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Things go from bad to worse for Freddie and Nugget's in trouble for taking Jordan to Denzel's party. Denise reveals all her secrets to an enraged Kim and Jack and Amy comfort Howie as he worries for Denzel

programme.title: Interior Design Masters
programme.desc: The designers each have two days, a painter, a carpenter and £1,000 to transform a 1930s beach chalet to fit their different briefs. Peter is determined to put being in the bottom four behind him with a big and bold design for his family bolthole chalet and Tom supresses his instincts for cosy chic as he takes on a Caribbean-themed shack. Monika steps out of her usual gothic comfort zone to design a home for a group of friends called The Gin Club and Temi takes on a different approach for her eco-chalet. Jack takes his brief for a team building space for A&E staff as an opportunity to give back to the NHS staff that saved his life. Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen joins as a guest judge

programme.title: Anton & Giovanni's Adventures in Sicily
programme.desc: The pair make their way through the centre of the island in the final leg of their trip where they try their hands at pasta-making and synchronised swimming before heading to the outskirts of Palermo where Giovanni has lined up an overnight stay with a group of beer-brewing monks. Finally, they head into Palermo where Anton meets Giovanni's parents and unveils a surprise birthday present

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: The House of Paisley
programme.desc: The Rev Ian Paisley's moral and political crusade gains momentum as followers gather in thousands to back his uncompromising stance. But for how long can he maintain this power?

programme.title: Rain Dogs
programme.desc: A dysfunctional family attempt to go straight in a crooked world. After being kicked out of their apartment, Costello and Iris try to find housing before nightfall. Selby is back after a stint in prison and keen to connect with the pair. Costello and Selby don't know if they can trust each other, but as their search for a place to stay grows more desperate, they both stop at nothing to keep Iris safe

programme.title: Safe Haven (2013)
programme.desc: A mysterious woman arrives in a small coastal town looking to make a fresh start, but seems reluctant to discuss her past. As she forms a close friendship with a neighbour and falls for a single father, she begins to realise the time has come to confront the dark secrets she is fleeing from. Romantic drama based on Nicholas Sparks' novel, with Julianne Hough, Josh Duhamel and Cobie Smulders
