programme.title: Alba Today
programme.desc: BBC Alba joins Radio nan Gàidheal, the BBC's Gaelic language radio service

programme.title: Treubh an Tuathanais (Big Barn Farm)
programme.desc: Goraidh and Muireall disagree over which of the two of them is bravest and, as a result of this, they arrange challenges to confirm, once and for all, who is worthy of the title

programme.title: Su Pic (Peek Zoo)
programme.desc: Mgr Pìc has very good news as the new rainforest enclosure for the gorillas is ready for them to move into and he is super excited about it

programme.title: AH-AH/No-No
programme.desc: There's an awful noise coming from Cùlag’s house - and a crazy, wayward rocket that needs to be brought under control. Perhaps it needs a few more adjustments

programme.title: Pip & Posy
programme.desc: When the night is perfect to look for falling stars, Pip and Posy camp out in the garden, but Posy has very little patience. Pip shows her how it can be fun

programme.title: 'S E Iasg a Th'Annam (I'm a Fish)
programme.desc: Jellyfish gives us lots of facts about himself - how jellyfish resemble jelly, how they don't have a heart, or bones. Not only that, as they are see-through, you can see their dinner after they've eaten it

programme.title: Meaban is Moo
programme.desc: Linda tasks Meaban and Moo with finding three triangular-shaped items. Their hut is full of junk, so Meaban and Moo need to have a good rummage

programme.title: Piseag & Cuilean/Kit & Pup
programme.desc: Kit and Pup investigate the world of magnets

programme.title: Stòiridh
programme.desc: Derek MacIntosh reads Fuirich Mionaid, Bernard, written and illustrated by David McKee and translated into Gaelic by Donald John Macleod

programme.title: Ronia, Nighean a' Mheirlich/Ronja, the Robber's Daughter
programme.desc: The robbers are thieving and the sheriff and the soldiers are in pursuit. However, sadness falls over them when Sgallan speaks to them for the last time

programme.title: Geamaichean Gorach
programme.desc: Coinneach Clogaid is up to his usual bad behaviour

programme.title: Uaine
programme.desc: Calum is on the outskirts of Glasgow to find out more about wind power

programme.title: Damhan & Durrag/Pipas & Douglas
programme.desc: Be careful in the skate park

programme.title: Na Dana-thursan aig Tintin/The Adventures of Tintin
programme.desc: Tintin and Dìleas are drawn into another adventure, where they learn from Captain Adag about his ancestor, Sir Francis Adag, and about the evil pirate, Rackham Dearg

programme.title: Dealbhan Fraoich (Heather's Portraits)
programme.desc: Heather Dewar travels to Inveraray to meet and draw a charcoal portrait of singer-songwriter Ethel MacCallum

programme.title: SpeakGaelic
programme.desc: Joy Dunlop guides viewers through the first steps of speaking Gaelic

programme.title: An Là (News)
programme.desc: Local, national and international news and information from BBC Alba

programme.title: Fillte
programme.desc: A journey throughout Scotland to discover the history and contemporary hand-crafted practice behind the artisan production of woven fabrics, such as wool, hemp, linen, grasses, leather and many more unorthodox materials

programme.title: Nadar - An Cunnart/Back from the Brink
programme.desc: Part two of two. The German conservationists teaching an almost extinct species to fly to its traditional migration grounds and how Swedish TV turned the moose into a TV star to demonstrate the impact of the climate emergency

programme.title: Fraochy Bay
programme.desc: Poet-in-residence Torquil Farquhar de Smith tries to capture the essence of Fraochy Bay in verse

programme.title: Under Canvas
programme.desc: Ellen MacDonald looks back at the summer music festival from Eden Court. With music from Mischa Nic a' Phearsain, Josie Duncan and Malin Makes Music

programme.title: Am Posadh Afraganach/The African Wedding
programme.desc: Humanitarian Gemma Steele and her husband Sean MacKinnon make a special trip for a second wedding celebration with her other family in Kenya

programme.title: Scotland's Wild Side
programme.desc: Coinneach MacFhraing seeks out unclimbed lines and challenging new routes on the remote and beautiful island of Rona

programme.title: Alba Today
programme.desc: BBC Alba joins Radio nan Gàidheal, the BBC's Gaelic language radio service

programme.title: Alba Today
programme.desc: BBC Alba joins Radio nan Gàidheal, the BBC's Gaelic language radio service

programme.title: AH-AH/No-No
programme.desc: There's an awful noise coming from Cùlag’s house - and a crazy, wayward rocket that needs to be brought under control. Perhaps it needs a few more adjustments

programme.title: Meaban is Moo
programme.desc: Linda tasks Meaban and Moo with finding three triangular-shaped items. Their hut is full of junk, so Meaban and Moo need to have a good rummage

programme.title: Nannag a' Noo/Huggleboo
programme.desc: Huggleboo has made a cook's hat for Grandpa Moustache

programme.title: Oscar & Ealasaid
programme.desc: Objects are disappearing all over town - Célestine's notebook, Boléro's hat, Mrs Tupile's binoculars and even the Green Mouse's cape. What's going on here?

programme.title: Shane an Chef
programme.desc: Maggie acquires an unusual vegetable for Shane to cook with - but it is so strange, that Mario and Jay are convinced it has come from outer space

programme.title: 'S E Iasg a Th'Annam (I'm a Fish)
programme.desc: A tropical frogfish shows us how they walk across the sea floor and he also tells us how they defend themselves

programme.title: Stòiridh
programme.desc: Catriona MacKinnon reads Poca Mòr nan Draghan by Virginia Ironside, illustrated by Frank Rodgers and translated into Gaelic by Jo Macdonald

programme.title: An Saoghal Droil aig Pol Ploc/The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: The biggest sporting event in Grimsby – the annual bog roll roll - takes place

programme.title: Damhan & Durrag/Pipas & Douglas
programme.desc: It’s boogey time

programme.title: Clann Na Cruinne
programme.desc: Hikari gets advice on growing rice from Mr Yamanaka, who has been a rice farmer for over 50 years. She enjoys the process so much, she decides she wants to be a rice farmer when she grows up
An insight into D K Macphee's life at 12 years old

programme.title: Geamaichean Gorach
programme.desc: Everyone should be careful today as Fearchar is attempting archery

programme.title: Proiseact Ploigh
programme.desc: Science and comedy, featuring contributions from expert Ishbel Murray, gag gangs from Tain, Harris and Skye with features on Pointillism, Vortex and a slinky laser

programme.title: Turas a' Bhradain
programme.desc: Neen MacKay examines how, over several centuries, salman has featured in the literature and lore of Scotland, from the writing of Neil Gunn to the celebrated Gaelic poetry of Alasdair Mac Mhaighstir Alasdair

programme.title: SpeakGaelic
programme.desc: Miriam Donaghey from the Isle of Lewis is Joy Dunlop’s guest in the studio, and Calum Maclean is in a park in Edinburgh as he tries an activity he’s never heard of or tried before

programme.title: An Là (News)
programme.desc: Local, national and international news and information from BBC Alba

programme.title: Wild Atlantic Way
programme.desc: Anne Lundon takes to the road for a journey along Ireland's spectacular Wild Atlantic Way

programme.title: Cinema Gadelica
programme.desc: Featuring clips from great movies, Cinema Gadelica reveals how movie makers have been drawn to the Highlands & Islands to film amid the spectacular scenery of the Gaidhealtachd

programme.title: Trusadh (Compelling Stories)
programme.desc: A look at the remarkable work of world-renowned genealogist Bill Lawson from Harris. The wealth of his work over the years includes local village and crofting histories

programme.title: Machair
programme.desc: Gaelic soap based on the Isle of Lewis

programme.title: Dàn
programme.desc: Catriona Murray talks about how poetry can evoke memories of a person. She reads 'An Luchag 's an Cat' which immediately reminds her of her cousin who is no longer alive

programme.title: Alleluia! (Spiritual Music & Verse)
programme.desc: Iain Mackinnon presents psalms, hymns and personal faith stories. Maeve MacKinnon sings Mo Chreideamh ‘G Amharc Suas and Rosemary Ward explains the role of faith in her life

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing is building a sandcastle and is joined by Pando, who has brought his toy dumper truck to help with the construction

programme.title: Nannag a' Noo/Huggleboo
programme.desc: Huggleboo asks her mum for a dog

programme.title: Abadas
programme.desc: The three friends set off on a fun-filled trip in search of a camera

programme.title: Òrain CBeebies
programme.desc: A selection of crofting songs from Carrie, Linda, Ruairidh and the CBeebies ALBA presenters

programme.title: Pip & Posy
programme.desc: When the night is perfect to look for falling stars, Pip and Posy camp out in the garden, but Posy has very little patience. Pip shows her how it can be fun

programme.title: Stòiridh
programme.desc: Alasdair MacLennan reads Uair a bha Siud air Adharc Aon-adharcach, written and illustrated by Beatrice Blue and translated into Gaelic by Morag Stewart

programme.title: Kung Fu Panda
programme.desc: Shifu's father visits the Jade Palace, but Po is disappointed to learn that he and his son do not get along

programme.title: Uaine
programme.desc: Calum is on the outskirts of Glasgow to find out more about wind power

programme.title: Geamaichean Gorach
programme.desc: Stand aside as they are diving today and it is going to be messy

programme.title: Na Dana-thursan aig Tintin/The Adventures of Tintin
programme.desc: There's a secret attached to the old model boats and especially the pieces of an old treasure map, which was hidden inside them

programme.title: Dealbhan Fraoich (Heather's Portraits)
programme.desc: Heather Dewar travels to Inveraray to meet and draw a charcoal portrait of singer-songwriter Ethel MacCallum

programme.title: SpeakGaelic
programme.desc: Joy Dunlop guides viewers through the first steps of speaking Gaelic

programme.title: An Là (News)
programme.desc: Local, national and international news and information from BBC Alba

programme.title: Cidsin Granaidh Chalanais
programme.desc: Gregor visits his auntie Ann to find out more about cooking in the family and smokes his own fish to add a modern twist to grannie's fishcake recipe

programme.title: Cold War Hockey
programme.desc: Documentary telling the story of when Scotland's women's hockey team was invited to play against West Germany in Berlin in September 1961. It was just weeks after the Berlin Wall had been constructed, and as former players recall, many of them feared the world was on the brink of war

programme.title: FUNC
programme.desc: Comedy sketch show. From President Trump calling his cousin in Lewis, to radio shows with a rude twist to the Zebras trying to board Noah's Ark, FUNC takes a comic swipe at the Gaelic and non-Gaelic world

programme.title: Women's Sport 360
programme.desc: Iona Ballantyne presents the show that gets to the heart of remarkable women and empowering stories in Scottish sport

programme.title: Tuaman Na h-Eiphit/Tombs of Egypt
programme.desc: After three months of excavations and dozens of sarcophagi found, more surprises lie in store for this team of Egyptian scientists. Having given up hope, they at last find a stone sarcophagus that apparently belongs to a vizier who lived during the New Kingdom

programme.title: Alba Today
programme.desc: BBC Alba joins Radio nan Gàidheal, the BBC's Gaelic language radio service

programme.title: DNA Journey
programme.desc: Sisters Oti and Motsi Mabuse head on a journey across their homeland of South Africa to explore their extraordinary family history. The sisters have tried to explore their history before, but with records for black South Africans almost non-existent, going on their DNA journey is the last roll of the dice to discover their roots. Beginning their journey just north of Johannesburg, the sisters are delighted to connect with their cousin Samantha, who reveals their familial link to an African Royal family. Later, the pair trace other branches of their family line and discover a brave ancestor who fought in World War Two, before finding out they are also related to the famous South African musician, Hotstix Mabuse

programme.title: Emmerdale

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and his team are in the Wirral to create a jungle inspired outdoor space for Conrad and Pauline Toohey, who have dedicated their lives to helping others, including severely disabled son Keiron. Their garden is so overgrown some of the family have not used it for decades, so Alan and the team transform the garden into a tranquil retreat with a pond to attract wildlife, and covered pergola surrounded by tropical planting. Meanwhile, Frances Tophill is in Cornwall to visit the UK's only outdoor jungle at the Lost Gardens of Heligan, where she helps head gardener Cindy plant some pond lilies

programme.title: Long Lost Family: What Happened Next
programme.desc: Revisiting seven of the programme's most extraordinary searchers to discover how their lives have been transformed since finding their missing relatives. The first episode catches up with Joselyn Taylor, who had been searching for her brother James for over 20 years, and Roy Sibblies, who was looking for his birth mother after discovering at 18 that he was adopted

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: ITV News London
programme.desc: Headlines affecting the local area

programme.title: Starstruck
programme.desc: Olly Murs hosts as four more teams of superfans are transformed into their music idols before stepping onto the stage to sing one of their biggest hits. Panellists Adam Lambert, Shania Twain, Beverley Knight and Jason Manford decide their favourite of the night before the voting audience pick just one person to go through to the series final. Plus, a special duet performance by judges Adam and Beverley

programme.title: Jason & Clara: In Memory of Maudie
programme.desc: Actor Jason Watkins and his wife Clara Francis tell the emotional story of their daughter Maudie, who died suddenly aged just two and a half in the early hours of New Year's Day 2011. Maudie died of undiagnosed sepsis, a condition where the body's immune system overreacts to an infection, causing it to go into overdrive and attack the body's tissues and organs. Since the tragedy, Jason and Clara have been seeking to raise awareness of sepsis and also to help and give hope to other bereaved parents. Now, as the family are about to move from the flat where Maudie was born and died, they feel the time is right to tell their story and explore their own grief

programme.title: On Assignment
programme.desc: Reporter James Mates travels to Portugal to meet campaigners on both sides of a controversial new euthanasia law. Elsewhere, Dan Rivers travels to Alice Springs in Australia to ask why so many feel the country continues to fail its indigenous population and whether a proposed referendum on introducing a permanent Indigenous Voice to Parliament might be one step towards righting long-standing wrongs

programme.title: The Bay
programme.desc: Dean is faced with another life-changing event, and unable to deal with his grief, he returns to work. With tensions running high, Jenn fears fears that he may resort to doing something he regrets. Elsewhere, Conor takes matters with Maddie into his own hands

programme.title: The Olivier Awards
programme.desc: Highlights of the ceremony celebrating the best of British theatre, with West End star Hannah Waddingham hosting at the Royal Albert Hall, where contenders included Jodie Comer, Paul Mescal, Beverley Knight, David Tennant, Rose Ayling-Ellis and Marisha Wallace. programme.title: Tonight
programme.desc: Seven million on the NHS waiting list means seven million stories of fading health, pain and the fear treatment may come too late. As experts warn of a deadly toll, record numbers have turned to private healthcare - both here and abroad. Emily Morgan meets some of those selling homes, taking loans and fundraising to buy back their health

programme.title: James Martin's French Adventure
programme.desc: The chef's culinary tour of France leads him to the diverse and distinct region of the Camargue, a natural region located south of Arles. James begins at Les Marquises, the Laurent family's farm, where he learns about the Camargue bull, and barbecues local fish for the family. Later, he visits a rice farm and cooks a risotto using his own rice-brewed beer

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and his team share their favourite money-saving gardening tips, creating classic garden features that are big on impact and easy on the pocket. With the average cost of a full garden makeover now believed to be between seven and ten thousand pounds, Katie Rushworth and David Domoney come to the aid of two families of garden novices, who only half that amount to spend. Taking totally different approaches and encouraging the garden owners to get stuck in, they will try and help them build their dream garden without going over the three and half thousand-pound budget. Will the owners be impressed by the money saving makeovers?

programme.title: Blue Murder
programme.desc: Janine asks Richard to prioritise the case of a promising footballer who was killed while out celebrating his birthday with friends, but is annoyed to find his mind seems elsewhere. She soon finds herself investigating why her colleague is so distracted as well as attempting to solve the murder. Crime drama, guest starring Kate Ford, with Caroline Quentin and Ian Kelsey

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: Unexplained killings rock the Bodmin community, giving rise to fears that the so-called 'beast', a monster enshrined in local legend, has returned to wreak fresh havoc. Kersey ventures up onto the moors to investigate and does not return - so Wycliffe is forced to go it alone. Jack Shepherd and Jimmy Yuill star

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Danny Flint finds his bachelor lifestyle cut short by his sister's death, leaving him in charge of nine-year-old niece Cady. Meanwhile, Beth's efforts to balance motherhood and a nursing career pose a dilemma, and Anna and David finally tie the knot. Guest starring Elizabeth Spriggs, with Kerrie Taylor, Lesley Dunlop and Philip Middlemiss

programme.title: Never the Twain
programme.desc: The glamorous Veronica (Honor Blackman) appears on the scene, causing rival antique dealers Simon and Oliver to compete for more than just antiquities. With Donald Sinden and Windsor Davies

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Mike and Joe confront Dev in an effort to find out where Naveen is. Meanwhile, Karen is only too happy to live off Steve, despite his efforts to teach her the value of money

programme.title: Never the Twain
programme.desc: A gleeful Simon learns Oliver's shop has been burgled - but is forced to pay for his lack of sympathy when he needs a favour from his rival. Donald Sinden and Windsor Davies star

programme.title: Never the Twain
programme.desc: David and Lyn make a pact to tell each other the truth no matter what - though their fathers don't think honesty is always the best policy. Donald Sinden and Windsor Davies star

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Stubborn postmistress Evie does her best to make Kim feel unwelcome, but a secret from her past soon explains the shopkeeper's icy attitude. programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Sally is shocked by news of Megan's pregnancy and her mood is soured further by the discovery that Kim already knows about it. Work matters prove just as complicated when the nurses help a teenager in need of a kidney transplant whose health is further threatened by tensions between potential organ donors in her family. Guest starring Frances Barber and Stella Gonet alongside Samantha Giles, Holly Grainger and Denise Van Outen

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The detective sets out for Norfolk when a country publican begs him to help solve a murder - but is disappointed when the innkeeper turns out to be a budding author and the killing fictional. However, he soon has food for thought when a real death occurs - committed by a seemingly ghostly hand. Geraldine Alexander and Ian McCulloch guest star, with David Suchet

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Ventress investigates missing golf balls, and some lads break into a local war hero's home. Rural police drama, starring Derek Fowlds and William Simons

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Steph and Shelly hit on an idea to appease their angry guests, and Len plucks up the courage to ask Edna to dance

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Joe triggers the alarm and falls down a flight of stairs at the warehouse, knocking himself unconscious in the process. Meanwhile, the painting party gets into full swing

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Mike guesses what Joe's done after he sees the recovered Alahan stock at the factory and Richard is threatened with bankruptcy unless he comes up with some cash

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: While investigating the shooting of a council clerk, Barnaby and Jones discover he was an expert blackmailer. A phone number on the dead man's blotter sends the duo to the seaside in search of his latest targets - whose boat trip could conceal a motive for the killing. Meanwhile, Joyce is convinced a local farmer knows more than he is telling. Julia McKenzie and Grant Masters guest star, with John Nettles and Jason Hughes

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: Mary begins to emerge from her grief, and takes an interest in the running of the estate. However, her ambitions meet firm resistance from her father. Lady Rose MacClare, Lady Flintshire's daughter, finds herself in a predicament at a tea dance in York, while Mrs Hughes urges Carson to heal an old wound. Bates comes up with a plan to help Molesley, but will it work? Costume drama, starring Michelle Dockery, Hugh Bonneville, Lily James, Phyllis Logan, Jim Carter, Brendan Coyle and Kevin Doyle

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: The new sergeant's arrival could mean radical changes for Greengrass, and everyone is under suspicion when a girl reports a stalker in the village

programme.desc: The Midsomer Worthy amateur choir is thrown into panic when baritone Connor Simpson is killed on the eve of the prestigious regional Four Choirs competition. A birdwatcher is also murdered shortly after, and DCI Barnaby and DC Jones uncover bitter rivalry and tense marital relationships as they try to establish if there is a connection between the two cases. Peter Capaldi guest stars

programme.title: Blue Murder
programme.desc: Janine investigates the death of a family doctor, and when one of his colleagues disappears shortly afterwards she starts to believe all of the surgery's staff may be in danger. However, startling revelations about the GP's personal and professional life throw her suspicions into doubt. Crime drama, starring Caroline Quentin and Ian Kelsey

programme.desc: A murder victim is found in unusual circumstances, buried with a cache of 100-year-old timber. A likely suspect is soon identified, only to be shot dead by a mystery assassin - a development that has repercussions for DI Lane's love life. Jack Shepherd stars as the dour Cornish copper, with Helen Masters

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Denise Van Outen joins the cast as new district nurse Kim, a single parent with a shady past who doesn't take kindly to anyone prying into her affairs. Beth begins to have second thoughts as she and Tom prepare to leave the village, especially when friend Hattie reveals she has terminal cancer, and Ozias Harding takes up the reins at the factory once more. Prunella Scales guest stars

programme.title: Never the Twain

programme.desc: Richard devises a plan to rid Audrey of her savings and the police descend on the factory, causing Joe to fear the worst

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Doreen and Derek disrupt baby Joshua's christening with their petty squabbles, Richard has a copy of Audrey's key made and Dev agrees to accompany Sunita to a friend's wedding

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The residents of Elverton-cum-Latterly gather to hold a protest meeting about proposals for a supermarket in the centre of the village, but proceedings are brought to a halt by the discovery of the site adviser's body. Barnaby and Jones discover the victim had a penchant for acting out role-play scenarios with local women - but that is not the only secret the villagers are hiding. John Nettles and Jason Hughes star

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: An extravagant party at the Abbey gives the Crawleys an opportunity to reunite with old friends. Some guests, however, prove more welcome than others, and alongside the celebrations come skulduggery and heartache. Includes guest appearances by Former EastEnders heart-throb Nigel Harman (Dennis Rickman) and soprano Kiri Te Kanawa, who plays the role of real-life singer Dame Nellie Melba

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Resident rogue Greengrass comes off worst in a car deal and responds by seizing goods from the local likely lad who took advantage of him - including a live python. Elsewhere, Mike investigates a case of food poisoning - and it seem a feud may be the cause of the trouble. Bill Maynard and Jason Durr star

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: The detective investigates after a botanist accidentally unearths the body of a recently buried professor who was fixated upon solving a seemingly impossible riddle by Lewis Carroll. The victim had a long-standing rivalry with his brother - giving Lewis and Hathaway an obvious suspect - but the case is hindered by the mind games of two students who seem intent on causing trouble in their quest to gain admittance to a mysterious club. Guest starring Celia Imrie and James Fleet, with Kevin Whately and Laurence Fox

programme.title: Blue Murder

Drama, guest starring Richard Fleeshman, Jill Halfpenny and Neil Fitzmaurice

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes

programme.desc: CGI-animated update of the classic children's cartoon from the 1980s. Meanwhile, Penny has also become an agent in training and now has Brain as her assistant - the Chief then calls Penny to meet Talon, who is the agency's new recruit, and she instantly falls in love with him.

programme.title: Inspector Gadget

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit of the week is to the Royal Oak Inn, in Luxborough, Somerset, run by Spencer Braydon-Phillips, who is joined in the competition by his good friend Gavin Rees. The guests arrive to the 14th-century inn with high expectations, but are shocked to find the standards to be fairly ordinary. In the bar, competition talk turns tense and boiler troubles overnight pour cold water on the guests' stays.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final day of the competition finds the hosts meet for the last time to find out how much they've been paid and to settle some scores. The guests rifle through their feedback, from troubles over breakfast hampers and hot tub rooms to interesting décor decisions. One host's tit-for-tat approach also comes under scrutiny. programme.title: Celebrity Hunted
programme.desc: Comedians James Acaster and Ed Gamble, Strictly dancer Katya Jones, Olympic snowboarder Aimee Fuller, actors Nicola Thorp and Nikesh Patel, mathematician Bobby Seagull, social media star Saffron Barker and TV therapists Nik and Eva Speakman go on the run across mainland UK while an elite team of police and military personnel try to track them down. The hunters being armed with the powers of the state - CCTV and ANPR cameras, drones, dogs, mobile phone tracking and social media publicity campaigns, means the celebrities have to be creative to evade capture. As the competitors escape from Shrewsbury prison and go on the run, the hunters are instantly on their tails, tracking them with CCTV cameras and a helicopter. programme.title: Grand Designs

The couple employed a method of building that allowed them to assemble the property in just 15 days on a budget of £300,000, but with so much attention given to the speed of construction, there was little time to think how the house might be to live in

programme.title: George Clarke's Old House, New Home
programme.desc: George gets to celebrate one of his favourite periods of British architecture when he helps out at an arts and crafts Edwardian terrace house in Addiscombe, south London. Cookie and Sophia bought their home six months ago, but, despite it being full to the brim with amazing original features, from fireplaces to balustrades and stained-glass windows, it needed some serious TLC. This renovation is a labour of love as the couple set about painstakingly restoring the features by themselves. George visits the wallpaper library of his all-time design hero William Morris, and tries his hand at block printing

programme.desc: Dan journeys back to 1323 BC, as he investigates an injury the pharaoh sustained towards the end of his life, an injury that would eventually result in his death. A scan of Tutankhamun's skeleton reveals a break to his thigh bone, and whilst visiting the Grand Egyptian Museum, Dan comes across 130 walking sticks which were found in his tomb, which suggest the young king was unable to walk unaided before his death

programme.title: Tutankhamun with Dan Snow
programme.desc: Dan investigates why the faces on Tut's coffins and canopic jars look more like a woman, and archaeologist Raksha Dave examines a recently restored box used for the pharaoh's clothes and discovers evidence to suggest it may actually have belonged to Nefertiti. Meanwhile, John Sergeant revisits his Strictly days as he learns how to dance like an Egyptian at a funeral

programme.title: Great Artists
programme.desc: Tim Marlow examines the life and legacy of German painter Albrecht Durer, who set a new benchmark in self-portraiture and raised the artistic reputation of northern Europe to a level rivaling that of Renaissance Italy. Like his contemporary Leonardo da Vinci, Durer perceived the world with a scientist's eye, and his detailed studies of plants and animals remain unrivalled to this day

programme.desc: Documentary examining the week leading up to the royal wedding of Prince Charles and Lady Diana Spencer in July 1981, which lifted the spirits of the nation during a turbulent time. Interviewees include people who knew the couple, such as Mary Robertson, Col Robert Spencer and Angela Rippon, who carried out a pre-wedding interview as well as presenting the live coverage on the day

programme.title: Shock Docs
programme.desc: Documentary exploring some of Britain's most bizarre parent-child relationships, where the mums and dads will do anything to look better than their kids. Those featured include 39-year-old Georgina, who was once a frumpy mum but has now followed daughter Kayla by becoming the image of a Barbie doll, complete with fake boobs and lips. Forty-five-year-old Paul is constantly muscling in on the action with his 18-year-old bodybuilder son Kyle, and former glamour model Charmaine loves flaunting what she has, much to the embarrassment of 14-year-old Yasmin. But when she decides to go back to modelling, how will her daughter react?

programme.title: Great Artists
programme.desc: Tim Marlow examines the work of Italian Renaissance painter Raffaello Santi, known better simply as Raphael, who was born in 1483 and achieved so much in his 37-year life that he was considered equal to Leonardo da Vinci and Michelangelo. He was highly regarded for his many studies of the Madonna and Child, and artists adopted his idealised forms as the model of beauty until the end of the 19th century

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: The family heads to Paris, where the Donkeys take them to the top of the Eiffel Tower, but Daddy Pig does not like heights

programme.title: The SpongeBob Movie: Sponge Out of Water (2015)
programme.desc: The cheery sea creature tries to prevent a precious secret formula from falling into the wrong hands - but when it goes missing, the end of the world approaches. SpongeBob and his friends embark on a quest to get it back, which leads to them developing superpowers and venturing onto dry land. Animated comedy, with the voices of Tom Kenny and Antonio Banderas

programme.title: Black Knight (2001)
programme.desc: An employee at a run-down medieval theme park suffers a nasty fall and knocks himself out - only to wake up in 14th-century England, where he gets up to all manner of mischief with the knights in shining armour and damsels in distress. Comedy adventure, starring Martin Lawrence, Tom Wilkinson and Marsha Thomason

programme.title: The Black Shield of Falworth (1954)
programme.desc: The son of a disgraced medieval nobleman is raised in poverty. With the support of a kindly earl, he gains the chance to train as a knight and reclaim his birthright, proving his worth by fighting to foil a plot to overthrow the king. Swashbuckling adventure, starring Tony Curtis, Janet Leigh, David Farrar and Barbara Rush

programme.title: The Wackiest Ship in the Army (1960)
programme.desc: A naval officer is given the command of an old sailing ship to undertake a very important mission - to transport an Australian agent into enemy waters so he can spy on the Japanese. However, he finds the ship is falling apart at the seams and is manned by a crew that does not know how to sail her. Second World War comedy, with Jack Lemmon, Ricky Nelson, John Lund, Chips Rafferty and Tom Tully

programme.title: Junior (1994)
programme.desc: A fertility expert pioneers a treatment enabling men to become pregnant and carry babies to full term. When the authorities cancel funding for the research, he decides to test it on himself, but gives little thought to how difficult it will be to keep it a secret. The situation is further complicated when he starts to fall for the woman whose child he is carrying. Comedy, with Arnold Schwarzenegger, Danny DeVito, Emma Thompson and Frank Langella

programme.title: The Predator (2018)
programme.desc: When a young boy accidentally signals the galaxy's most lethal hunters who set course for Earth, an eclectic band of former soldiers and a scientist attempt to prevent the end of the human race. Director Shane Black's fourth entry in the sci-fi thriller saga, starring Boyd Holbrook, Trevante Rhodes, Jacob Tremblay, Keegan-Michael Key and Olivia Munn

programme.title: La Haine (1995)
programme.desc: Three men from different racial backgrounds hang around their tough neighbourhood in the aftermath of a riot in which one of their friends was critically injured by the police. However, one of the trio has a secret - he has obtained a gun that a policeman lost during the fighting, and plans to put it to vengeful use if his friend dies. Drama, starring Vincent Cassel, Hubert Kounde and Said Taghmaoui. In French

programme.title: Hyena (2014)
programme.desc: A corrupt cop with access to all the money and drugs he needs suddenly finds his comfortable way of life turned upside down by the arrival of ruthless Albanian gangsters in his patch of London. Crime thriller, starring Peter Ferdinando, Stephen Graham and Neil Maskell

programme.title: Megamind (2010)
programme.desc: An evil genius finally succeeds in killing the superhero who has foiled his every evil scheme, but finds life without an enemy boring. To fill the gap, he transforms an ordinary man into a worthy adversary - but when his creation turns evil, it falls to the villain to save the world. Animated comedy, with the voices of Will Ferrell, Tina Fey and Brad Pitt

programme.title: Kung Fu Panda (2008)
programme.desc: A hero is needed to defend a peaceful valley community from attack by a rampaging snow leopard. The unlikely candidate for the job is a lazy panda, who enlists the aid of a legendary team of animal fighters and their wise master to teach him the martial arts skills he needs to fulfil his destiny. Animated comedy, with the voices of Jack Black, Dustin Hoffman, Angelina Jolie, Ian McShane and Jackie Chan

programme.title: The Colditz Story (1954)
programme.desc: A medieval castle in Germany is turned into a PoW camp during the Second World War, and used to house the most rebellious Allied prisoners, all of whom have made repeated escape attempts. Although breaking out is supposedly impossible, the determined inmates refuse to be beaten and continue their bid for freedom. Second World War drama, starring John Mills and Eric Portman

programme.title: Run Silent, Run Deep (1958)
programme.desc: A commander aboard a US Navy submarine has a titanic clash of egos with his second in command as the senior officer's obsession with sinking as many enemy vessels as possible, whatever the risk, spirals out of control. Second World War drama, starring Clark Gable, Burt Lancaster, Jack Warden, Brad Dexter and Don Rickles

programme.title: Stardust (2007)
programme.desc: A young shop assistant in Victorian England enters a magical parallel world in search of a fallen star to give to the girl of his dreams. However, the star in question is in fact a beautiful woman, who he helps flee from a wicked witch and a murderous prince. Fantasy adventure, based on Neil Gaiman's novel, with Charlie Cox, Claire Danes, Michelle Pfeiffer, Robert De Niro, Mark Strong and Sienna Miller. Narrated by Ian McKellen

programme.title: Colombiana (2011)
programme.desc: A 10-year-old Colombian girl witnesses the murder of her parents at the hands of gangsters, but is rescued by her uncle, who takes her to the US and raises her to be a cold-blooded killer. Years later, she is still working for him as an assassin, but is secretly planning to avenge her parents' deaths. Action thriller, starring Zoe Saldana, Cliff Curtis, Michael Vartan and Lennie James

programme.title: Kingsman: The Secret Service (2015)
programme.desc: A streetwise teenager is taken under the wing of his dead father's old colleague, an agent working for a super-secret spy organisation. Will the youngster turn out to be a chip off the old block by proving useful during a battle against a twisted, hi-tech genius? Action comedy based on a comic book, starring Colin Firth, Taron Egerton and Samuel L Jackson

programme.title: Mike and Dave Need Wedding Dates (2016)
programme.desc: Hard-partying brothers Mike and Dave place an online advertisement to find the perfect 'wholesome' dates for their sister's wedding in Hawaii. Unfortunately, their efforts to snare respectable women fall flat when wayward best friends Tatiana and Alice see an opportunity for a debauched free holiday and concoct a plan to deceive the siblings. Comedy, starring Zac Efron, Anna Kendrick, Adam Devine and Aubrey Plaza

programme.title: Little Monsters (1989)
programme.desc: Brian is a lonely 11-year-old who's just moved to Boston with his family. He's having a hard time making friends in his new neighbourhood, and to make matters worse, he wakes up one morning to find he's being blamed for a stack of pranks that he swears he hasn't done. However, a blue-skinned monster called Maurice soon changes his life forever. Comedy, starring Fred Savage, Howie Mandel and Daniel Stern

programme.title: Madagascar 3: Europe's Most Wanted (2012)
programme.desc: The escaped zoo animals continue their quest to get back to their New York home. Having made it to Monte Carlo, they join a circus on a European tour as a means of travelling undetected - but an animal control agent is in hot pursuit. Animated comedy, with the voices of Ben Stiller, Chris Rock, David Schwimmer and Jada Pinkett Smith

programme.title: The Man in the White Suit (1951)
programme.desc: A put-upon chemist's invention of an indestructible dirt-proof fibre brings him into conflict with clothing industry moguls who foresee their profits disappearing down the drain - and promptly vow to put a stop to his plans. Satirical Ealing comedy, starring Alec Guinness, Joan Greenwood, Cecil Parker and Michael Gough

programme.title: The Ghost and Mrs Muir (1947)
programme.desc: A lonely widow moves into a seaside cottage, despite rumours that it is haunted. Sure enough, she finds herself sharing her home with the spirit of a dead sea captain - but his efforts to scare her away prove unsuccessful, and instead a growing attraction develops between the pair as she agrees to write his biography. Romantic fantasy, starring Gene Tierney, Rex Harrison and George Sanders

programme.title: Sahara (2005)
programme.desc: An explorer stumbles upon evidence that an American Civil War battleship, which was laden with treasure when it sank without trace, has ended up somewhere in the Sahara. However, he is deflected from his mercenary quest to find the hoard by an encounter with a tenacious doctor, whose battle to stop the spread of a deadly disease could be linked to his own mission. Adventure, starring Matthew McConaughey, Penelope Cruz and Steve Zahn

programme.title: Jack Reacher (2012)
programme.desc: A former army sniper is arrested following a random shooting that leaves five people dead, but protests his innocence. An elusive former military police investigator is called in to examine the case, and becomes convinced a conspiracy is at work. Action thriller based on Lee Child's series of novels, starring Tom Cruise, Rosamund Pike, Werner Herzog and Robert Duvall

programme.title: Lynch/Oz (2022)
programme.desc: Alexandre O'Philippe's documentary about David Lynch looks to pull back the curtain on the influence that 1939's The Wizard of Oz starring Judy Garland has had upon the director's visionary work. The film is constructed from six visual essays by David Lowery, Karyn Kusama, John Waters, Rodney Ascher, Justin Benson and Aaron Moorhead, and critic Amy Nicholson

programme.title: Wild Indian (2021)
programme.desc: A successful businessman who has turned his back on his old life in Wisconsin is reminded of his past by his jailbird cousin. Thriller, starring Michael Greyeyes, Chaske Spencer, Jesse Eisenberg and Kate Bosworth

programme.desc: Tony receives an unexpected call from Eric asking him to go and visit him in prison. Elsewhere, James and Ste's wedding planning is well underway

programme.desc: Leonard and Howard attempt to distract Sheldon with a trip to a historic railway when he slows the progress of their work on the Air Force guidance system. Raj and Stuart look after baby Halley, while Penny and Amy take Bernadette out

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Jay switches sides after joining Cam's bowling team, while Phil and Claire see a different side to their neighbours. American comedy following the lives of three dysfunctional households - a man who struggles to keep up with his younger wife, an embarrassing husband and a gay couple getting used to parenthood after adopting a Vietnamese baby. programme.desc: Jake badly injures himself while chasing down a suspect, but then refuses to take time off from work to recover. Holt and Rosa have an awkward dinner date with their significant others, so they invite Amy and Gina along as well. Andy Samberg stars

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Jake is excited to work a case with the best detective in the NYPD, Dave Majors - until his colleague shares his intentions to ask Amy out on a date. Rosa's surprising fashion choice causes a stir, and Charles and Gina make an unexpected discovery. Comedy, with Andy Samberg

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny feels threatened when a sexy actress, who has landed a role in TV series CSI, moves into the apartment building, and gradually begins to sense that her friends are being manipulated by the new arrival. Comedy, starring Kaley Cuoco, Valerie Azlynn, Johnny Galecki and Simon Helberg

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny catches the eye of comic-book shopkeeper Stuart, and Leonard is devastated when she gives serious consideration to dating her new admirer. An underwhelming day out touring the village of Laxton is saved only by the hosts' personalities, though later two of the B&Bers have a disagreement over dinner

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: On payment day, Angie and Caitlin are keen to get to the bottom of some cutlery quibbles. Morgan's upset about some cleanliness complaints, while Kadir thinks some of his fellow B&Bers have been unfair by saying they wouldn't return to his B&B

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer are house-hunting for two couples who are keen to get on the property ladder in Swindon. Kirstie meets Candice and Alistair, who are looking to move out of Alistair's bachelor pad and into a family home as they are expecting the arrival of their first baby. Meanwhile, Phil is in the countryside between Swindon and Newbury where he meets James and Hayley, who are looking for a rural retreat for themselves and their two dogs

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help a pair of baptist ministers with their four-bedroom in Alnwick, Northumberland. Having grown up on the same street, Chris is ready for a change of scenery and a bigger, more user-friendly space for combining work and family needs - including fitting up to 14 people round a dining table. Caroline, however, loves their home, and particularly the neighbours who brought her, Chris and their teenagers comfort while she was undergoing cancer treatment

programme.title: Chateau DIY
programme.desc: At Chateau de Lalande, Stephanie and Gerry go bold with a colourful project in the tower staircase that Stephanie wants to turn in to a pigeonniere - a place to keep pigeons. In cognac country, Sarah and George are under pressure renovating a bedroom in time for a wedding in just a week's time. Cameras also return to Chateau de la Ruche, where Tim and Rebecca's gite conversion has moved on to the next stage

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets Greg and Georgie who are taking on the highly ambitious task of converting a dilapidated, 35-year-old barn in Kent. The build will be a huge challenge involving the painstaking conservation of the existing rotten structure, building a new two-storey internal steel frame and recycling everything they can to stretch their £250,000 budget

programme.title: Jonathan Ross' Myths and Legends
programme.desc: Jonathan delves into the truth behind the legends of King Arthur, goes in search of the Beast of Bodmin, and pays a visit to fantasy artist Brian Froud. His journey around the British Isles ends at Glastonbury Tor, where he meets an Earth Priestess and assists in a ceremony in tribute to the Arthurian enchantress Morgan Le Fay

programme.title: Skeletons of the Mary Rose: The New Evidence
programme.desc: Scientists and historians use isotope and DNA analysis to identify the crew of Henry VIII's flagship, which sank off the coast of Portsmouth in 1545. With the help of Mary Rose Trust curator Alex Hildred, the programme uncovers evidence that many of the sailors were of African origin, and traces surviving descendants of the only two members of the crew who can be identified by name. Plus, the little-known story of a 16th-century Guinean free-diver who retrieved several treasures from the wreck

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A 71-year-old woman is rushed in after being knocked over by her husband's car, and her blood pressure has dropped critically low. Four-year-old Maddi is brought in with an injured neck after falling over on a train, and doctors worry that metal plates she already had in her neck may have shifted, causing damage to her spine. Plus, 68-year-old Bonnie arrives after hitting her head on her bedside table

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty investigates shock reports that changing sea temperatures mean squid and chips could one day replace fish and chips as the UK's national dish, and heads to Thailand, where squid is a national obsession. Kate Quilton goes Down Under to find out about a surprising new meat coming into our supermarkets and Matt Tebbutt heads to Italy to find out how supermarkets can sell pesto at an affordable price when the traditional ingredients are famously expensive

programme.title: Kirstie's Handmade Treasures
programme.desc: In this bite-sized episode, Kirstie Allsopp plans to surprise her guests with two main courses - roast beef with mulled wine gravy, and masala cauliflower with coconut stuffing for the vegetarians

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Charlie and Mandy first met 20 years ago on the island of Cyprus and have now decided to make it a base for regular family holidays with their two young daughters. Jonnie Irwin scours the market to show them a mix of properties for their maximum budget of £135,000

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: A mix-up at the pumps leaves a diving instructor stranded in Marbella, and two London coppers crash their van on the way to Spain

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien explore a fairground, and collect a bicycle made for two, a ship's search lamp and a lambing chair

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: In Gloucestershire, Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien visit landed gent Sir Benjamin Slade as they search for more upcycling prospects. Simon converts a gilded picture frame into a flat-screen TV surround, while Henry refurbishes a club fender fire surround and turns a quick profit on a Fordson tractor

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: Probate detectives try to locate the relatives of William Bennett, a member of the Pioneer Corps during the Second World War, and hear rumours he may have had two daughters. Elsewhere, investigators in Lincolnshire discover the glamorous history of a large Grimsby family while searching for heirs to a £42,000 estate

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: This week's competition begins in Newquay in Cornwall, at Avalon Guest House, where the owners' taste in lime green decor does not prove as relaxing as planned for the guests

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The hoteliers spend the night at the Bear Inn at Wincanton, Somerset, where ex-Army man Matt Garvin takes them for a day of survival training - and as a trained chef, hopes to serve up a perfect breakfast

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The rivals head to Bournemouth, where Chris and Nicky Horton run the Chelsea Hotel. For entertainment, they treat the guests to a day on the water - but the weather is against them

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The last visit of the week is to the Holford Arms in Tetbury in Gloucestershire, where Will Robson and Loz Cooper are hoping to put their pub's prized produce into the spotlight to ensure the B&Bers have a fulfilling stay. However, the bedrooms produce some unwelcome surprises for two sets of guests, getting things off to a less-than-perfect start

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contest that began at Avalon Guest House in Cornwall sees the B&Bers meet up to air their grievances from that stay and the three others that followed. Two sets of B&Bers have an argument over breakfast comments, while facilities failures prove to be a big point of contention. After the disagreements are settled, the payments are revealed and the winners are crowned

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer are house-hunting for family homes in the West Midlands. Kirstie searches for properties in a family friendly suburb in Birmingham for Emma and Paul, while Phil heads to Solihull with Kate and Dan, who moved up from London 18 months ago to be closer to family and to find a long-term home

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer go head to head to help a couple who cannot decide to do with their home in Aylesbury, Buckinghamshire. Procurement manager Paul bought the house 13 years ago as a bachelor pad, but since cabin crew worker Sophie moved in they have had two children and he wants to move to a bigger, better family home. However, she grew up on the same street, her parents are just down the road and she loves having them on hand for babysitting. Can Kirstie make the necessary renovations to persuade Paul to stay? Or will Phil find a new good enough home to tempt Sophie away?

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau: DIY
programme.desc: At Billy and Gwendoline's chateau, Billy and his father try to level a patio so it can pass health and safety regulations. As Paul and Karen struggle to get the office conversion finished in time, a huge damaged pine tree needs to be cut down. While Clive's dad Martin attempts to fix a wall surrounding the lake, Clive investigates a huge, creepy nest in the roof of the orangery, the building that he hopes will one day be a house for his father

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows the progress of ex-advertising man Geoff, who is selling his luxury villa in Spain and moving into a caravan while he project manages the construction of a dramatically cantilevered steel-framed house on the Essex coast, costing a total of £700,000. But after the anchoring steel has been drilled into the ground, he runs into the double trouble - Covid-19 and a collapse in the Spanish property market. Will he ever finish this complicated - and expensive - construction?

programme.title: Home Greek Home
programme.desc: As the build comes together, Sarah turns her focus to the interiors and uses her considerable design skills to use every inch of the small space to create a home. Plus, a surprising decision to place a bath on the roof

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A road traffic accident caused 52-year-old Mark to suffer cardiac arrest, and as he battles for survival at St George's Hospital, his wife Jacquie reminisces about how their relationship blossomed from friendship into romance. A severe hip dislocation seems to be the diagnosis when 25-year-old Kayley arrives in A&E after being thrown from her horse, and 23-year-old receptionist Melissa books an appointment with nurse practitioner Craig to find out why she is having trouble hearing

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: Paramedics are called to reports of a man collapsed in the street and in cardiac arrest. When they arrive, he's surrounded by police officers who've been carrying out CPR. In other cases, a woman in severe abdominal pain has a panic attack as the paramedics try to get her breathing under control, while a man with a fast heart rate is vomiting blood

programme.title: Home Greek Home

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty travels to Turkey to investigate oregano, Kate Quilton examines the worrying rise in peanut allergies and Matt Tebbutt traces the British blackcurrant from the field to the Ribena factory

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty visits Mauritius to find out about white and dark rum and learns where the term 'proof' originally came from in relation to alcohol

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: The island of Crete holds a special place in the hearts of Roy and Caroline Loates as it's the place where they married. Now with a budget of £100,000, they want to make it their permanent home. Jasmine Harman selects five properties for them to choose between

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: A diving instructor in Marbella faces an uncertain future and, after being refused a mortgage back in London, a young couple head to Spain to start their own aerial yoga business

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien find, fix and flog unwanted possessions on behalf of their owners. Henry and Simon realise profit potential in an old crop sprayer, a cast iron fire guard and some old wooden workshop clamps

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Max McMurdo and Henry Cole visit a motorbike fan, making table lamps from engines and turning a pallet and iron wheels into a stylish modern coffee table

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The investigators uncover an interesting family history in the brewing trade while exploring the case of Evelyn Edwards. They also hunt for heirs to Garry Szymanski, who died in Birmingham in 2010, and try to find out if his father is still alive

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition commences at Churchill's Hotel in Barnsley, where the guests are treated to a day out at a nearby mill and the hotel's first ever breakfast service

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contest continues at Darnells' Farm Luxury Glamping in Ross-on-Wye, Herefordshire, where arachnophobe Snehal checks every corner of his lodging for unwanted eight-legged guests

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners stay the night at Hatton Court Hotel in Gloucester, a country style establishment that at first proves a hit - until cleanliness concerns, sleepless nights and missing breakfast items leave them disappointed

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The fourth and final visit is to the Ladbrooke Hotel in the heart of Birmingham, where manager Snehal Lakhani claims he accepts nothing less than perfection. A room with a broken window proves far from flawless for Natasha and Laura, while Danni and Graham are concerned about the proximity of a train line to their bedroom

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: On the final day of the competition, Churchill's Hotel's Jeff Brown and Vicky O'Loughlin are first to face the feedback and Jeff's keen to turn down the heating woes. Plus, Snehal from the Ladbrooke Hotel has a bone to pick with all of the B&Bers. After some frank discussions, the payments are revealed and the winner is announced

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Phil Spencer catches up with two couples whose property searches took some unexpected turns. In 2012, he was in Aberdeen helping Brian and Helen, who were relocating from Essex, with a house hunt featuring some cruel knocks along the way. How are the pair doing seven years on? In 2016, Mike and Sorrel needed Phil's help finding a home in the Tyne Valley. Having lost out on their dream home on the day they were meant to complete their purchase, they were looking to Phil to bring their two-year search to an end

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help Rachael and Tim, who cannot decide to do with their home in Wandsworth, south London. New Jersey-born Rachael wants to up sticks and move to the countryside to bring up their children in more rural surroundings, and she is finding their four-bedroom semi something of a squeeze. However, local lad Tim would rather stay closer to his friends and family. Kirstie comes up with a plan to make better use of the space, while Phil aims to show the couple three properties that prove the grass is greener outside the M25

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau: DIY
programme.desc: Tim and Margreeth visit Dick and Angel, who come up with some radical suggestions to change their business plans. Stephanie hopes to prepare for her first singles weekend by planting a romantic rose garden - if she can work the digger. Near the Pyrenees, Sophie and James need to raise funds for their ancient chateau fast, so they decide to put on a day of historic talks, dinner and a tour. Later, Dick and Angel struggle to rescue the trampoline that's been blown into their moat

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows the progress of Nathan and Amye as they build a giant cathedral-like property modelled on Dutch barn-style houses, but with a contemporary twist. It is a hugely ambitious plan, and with Nathan project managing and setting themselves just a year to finish the build, the pressure to pull it off is huge

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: A man is arrested after punching a man outside a nightclub - a single blow that led to the victim's death. In the interviews, the police try to determine whether the punch was an unjustified and aggressive assault on an innocent man or an act of self-defence with tragic consequences

programme.title: In the Footsteps of Killers
programme.desc: Emilia Fox and criminologist Professor David Wilson investigate famous unsolved murder cases, continuing with the disappearance of Suzy Lamplugh. The estate agent vanished after making an appointment with a client in July 1986. Despite the high profile of the case, nobody has ever been charged with Lamplugh's abduction and murder. Following a series of tantalising clues, Emilia and David narrow the field of suspects down to just one man. Will he reveal the truth?

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The air ambulance is dispatched to collect Frances, an 80-year-old woman who fell three metres into her empty swimming pool while gardening, and has sustained a head wound that could have resulted in a life-altering bleed on the brain. Ruth, aged 86, arrives at St George's A&E with her heart beating three times faster than the normal rate. Doctors are concerned it may not be pumping enough blood around her body, and quickly prescribe fast-acting medication. Plus, students Jerry and Sakille turn up at the hospital after Jerry crashed her car on the way home from a party. While Jerry stayed sober to serve as the designated driver, she concludes that balancing a full-time job with her studies and a hectic social life might not be a sensible idea

programme.title: Rick Stein's Secret France
programme.desc: The chef continues his 'journey without maps', leaving the main routes and tourist hotspots behind to embark on a personal road trip along picturesque and remote backroads. Here, he heads through France's eastern border regions of Alsace and Jura - famous for Comte cheese and home to his favourite French dish of choucroute garni. He then begins to head inland, visiting Burgundy for a memorable glass of Auxey-Duresses wine, and sampling oeuf en meurette with a difference. Following a memorable Sunday lunch near the French/Swiss border, he is inspired to recreate a traditional blueberry tart

programme.title: The Force: Behind the Line

programme.title: Top Gear

Rick tries out a new recipe - pork chops with a sloe berry sauce - before moving on to the village of Rock, where his son Jack holds a clam bake on the shore of the Camel Estuary

programme.desc: Billy's final leg begins in Virginia on the trail of bootleggers dealing in moonshine before he hears the story of the amazing woman who led hundreds of slaves to their freedom. programme.desc: The next part of Michael Portillo's journey from Southampton to Wolverhampton begins in Wokingham, Berkshire, where the former politician finds out how demand from a growing number of rail commuters fuelled the development of the modern printing press. programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on another journey around the nation with a copy of George Bradshaw's Victorian Railway Guidebook to discover how the railways have affected people and what remains of Bradshaw's Britain. With tensions already running high with Debs, things take a turn for the awkward over mains when Nikki lets her real feelings out and things get heated around the table. programme.title: A Place in the Sun

Eleven-year-old Chihuahua Gina is a pocket rocket with an attitude problem. It remains to be seen whether the trainers can teach an old dog new tricks

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Ever since Terry Windle and Julia Lenart got together 15 years ago, they have dreamed of having their own place in sunnier climes - and have decided Gran Canaria is the perfect place for them. Scarlette Douglas shows them five properties for their £100,000 budget

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Dentist Michelle Naik and retired entrepreneur Marshal Sutherland from Sheffield have fallen in love with the Caribbean island of Aruba. The couple have now decided it's the perfect place to find an island retreat. With a budget of £130,000 and the help of Scarlette Douglas, they hope to find a holiday home that could one day become a permanent retirement location

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: In Spain, a couple prepare for their first guests - but there's a lingering problem. There's slow progress at a gîte renovation project in France, and Covid-19 causes chaos for a couple's planned yoga retreat in Portugal

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Dairy farmer's wife and Disney enthusiast Charlene Fry-Henderson hosts the first dinner party in Dumfries and Galloway, where she hopes that her locally reared meat, home cooking, and entertainment involving a plastic cow will secure her the £1,000 prize. Her guests are local radio presenter Tommy Jardine, banker Olive Melville, prison custody officer Tammy Rice and trainee teacher Josh Jones

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Horse enthusiast and banker Olive Melville hosts the second dinner party in Dumfries and Galloway, where she hopes to impress her guests with a crab starter and mousse dessert - but things take a turn for the worse when a conversation about the royal family divides the diners

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Local radio DJ Tommy Jardine hosts the third dinner party in Dumfries and Galloway, and prepares chicken stuffed with haggis - but first he must continue a family tradition and rustle up a sheep for his entertainment. Tommy then tries to impress his guests with a touch of celebrity name-dropping, but young dance DJ and trainee teacher Josh trumps him at his own game

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Trainee teacher and club DJ Josh Jones hosts the fourth night in Dumfries and Galloway, and hopes he can broaden his fellow contestants' palates with his menu of Indian food. He plans lamb pasanda and tandoori monkfish, but Tammy Rice finds something in her glass that wasn't on the menu. However, Josh hopes his disco entertainment might impress the guests enough to bag him the £1,000 prize

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Tammy Rice hosts the final evening in Dumfries and Galloway, hoping to win the £1,000 prize with her no-nonsense approach and traditional Scottish fare. The dinner-party novice rustles up chorizo and cous cous stuffed peppers for her starter and incorporates haggis into her chicken-based main course

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Danni Menzies helps Anne and Ian from the Scottish Highlands find their perfect holiday home in the buzzing resort of Benidorm on Spain's Costa Blanca. The couple have a budget of £100,000 to help them realise their dreams

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Childhood sweethearts Thomas and Doreen from Sunderland have been dreaming of owning a holiday home in Spain since their first anniversary there 39 years ago. Scarlette Douglas searches far and wide to find them the perfect property in eastern Andalucía for their £55,000 budget. But will it be a modern apartment near the sea or a traditional cave house in the countryside that wins their hearts?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Chris and Marie are looking for the perfect place to enjoy their retirement in Manilva on Spain's Costa del Sol. Chris wants a property on a golf resort, while Marie wants to live closer to town. Danni Menzies hopes to help them find a happy compromise, with their budget of £125,000

programme.title: The Great Celebrity Bake Off for Stand Up to Cancer
programme.desc: Actor David Morrissey, comedian Lucy Beaumont, diver and Olympic medallist Tom Daley and radio presenter and cancer survivor Adele Roberts take on three challenges set by judges Paul Hollywood and Prue Leith. They must attempt a savoury quiche Signature, a Technical teatime biscuit and a showstopping day off in cake form

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on what they have been watching during the week, with cameras capturing their instant reactions and the lively discussions that are prompted by the week's biggest and best shows

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on various show from the past week, including Michael McIntyre's The Wheel, Jamie's £1 Wonders, Top Gear, Guillermo del Toro's Cabinet of Curiosities, Drink Masters, Wild Croc Territory, plus the woman marrying a ghost on This Morning and BBC News reporting on the new 50p coin

programme.title: Celebrity Hunted
programme.desc: Nikesh and Nicola risk an appearance on live TV in the Lake District while Ed and James go undercover in Greater Manchester. Everyone else is laying low in places from north Wales to Surrey and Brighton, but how long can they go out of sight of the hunters? All in aid of Stand Up to Cancer

programme.title: My Massive C**k
programme.desc: Men with exceptionally large penises reveal how this has affected their lives, from the embarrassment of people staring and difficulties with clothing, to uncomfortable sex and even causing injuries to their partners. While some have learned to live with the implications of their unusual bodies, others are considering surgical solutions to reduce the size

programme.title: Send Nudes: Body SOS

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Three-legged labrador Dave seeks a new best friend, and his owners Laura and Paul hope that Luna, the beautiful but nervous saluki, will win Dave over. Nine-year-old stray westie called Norman gets much attention from mother and son Lorraine and Oliver - upsetting youngster Cynthia, a Staffie cross. Meanwhile, enthusiastic setter-poodle pup Obi might just win the chance to bring the joy and chaos that Mike and his partner Tracey don't yet know they need in their lives

programme.title: The Dog Academy
programme.desc: A crack team of Britain's top specialist trainers instructs beleaguered owners in dog management skills and dog psychology. Ferocious cockapoo Bear is driving a wedge between owners Paul and Louise. With their marriage under stress, Victoria and Adam must help tame Bear's aggressive behaviour before it's too late. Eleven-year-old Chihuahua Gina is a pocket rocket with an attitude problem. Because of her penchant for attacking other dogs, mum and son Cindy and Cory have to carry her around in a special zipped-up safety bag. It remains to be seen whether the trainers can teach an old dog new tricks

programme.title: Food Unwrapped

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: Officers in Harrogate spot a youth behaving suspiciously, but when they try to stop him, he flees into a local housing estate and things rapidly escalate as a hostile crowd gathers. As they attempt to pull the car over, the suspects speed off and the chase is on. programme.title: Traffic Cops

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Paul Jackson has his work cut out stopping a runaway van driver who is causing havoc, while a street disturbance leads Paul Faulkner and Lee Wilson to stare down the barrels of a shotgun. Plus, Kev Salter and the team raid a cannabis farm and make a shocking discovery

programme.desc: An investigation into three murders in the offices of a magazine places the detectives in the middle of a fierce family feud, involving a protective matriarch, warring siblings and a corrupt judge. Award-winning police drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Benjamin Bratt

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The detectives respond to a hold-up committed by a bloodthirsty team of robbers in ski-masks, and McCoy struggles to determine whether the teenage tearaway found with the criminals was an unwilling hostage or a active participant in the crimes

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A woman is shot in her sleep, and further investigation leads the detectives to a boy whose drug-addicted mother has placed him in the care of her dealer. Crime drama, starring Jerry Orbach

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A college student is found dead, prompting the detective duo to search for a rapist on campus. However, a report from the medical examiner puts them on a different path, and they discover events may have gone down an even more sinister track

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A marine dies while saving the life of a foreign defence secretary, who was the target of an assassination attempt. Gibbs and the team are given the task of protecting the politician's daughter while she studies in America, but fail to stop her being kidnapped and ransomed in a bid to prevent her father signing an important treaty. Crime drama, starring Sean Murray and Michael Weatherly

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A marine's teeth and fingertips are found in a pickpocket's stolen purse, and Ducky discovers he had been tortured on a rack before dying. The agents realise he may have been killed in error, and that the real target was his ex-girlfriend, a skilled player of computer games who unwittingly uncovered a mysterious code. Crime drama, starring Michael Weatherly and Sean Murray

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The agents learn one of their former investigative assistants has been murdered, and had been selling information about how to rob a warehouse full of valuable possessions belonging to a woman convicted of fraud. As the case proceeds, Tony becomes infatuated with the new leader of another team, who apparently returns his feelings. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Michael Weatherly

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The officers investigate the death of a beloved commander who trained some of the top athletes in the country. Mark Harmon stars

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Stabler and Tutuola search for a kidnapped 17-year-old girl with a genetic condition that makes her appear much younger than she is, afraid she may have fallen into the clutches of a paedophile. As the case progresses, they find compelling evidence that the abduction was staged, and that the so-called victim had her own reasons for wanting to disappear. Drama, starring Christopher Meloni and Ice-T

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Stabler and new partner Beck investigate the rape of a woman who has accused a high-profile lawyer of the crime, but have difficulty proving their case. Another victim emerges with fresh evidence against the alleged assailant, but her testimony soon proves far from reliable. Guest starring Robin Weigert (Deadwood), with Connie Nielsen

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Two men are implicated in the rape and murder of a Canadian student, and the team finds enough evidence to have them charged - but the disappearance of the sole witness forces the judge to dismiss the case. Drama, starring Christopher Meloni and Mariska Hargitay

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: An autistic man dies in police custody, and when Briscoe and Logan investigate, they discover he was receiving a number of unusual and illegal treatments. The inquiry also sheds light on the deceased's parents, who seem reluctant to pursue a prosecution

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A banking associate is found murdered, and inquiries reveal he was having an affair with his high-powered boss, who seemingly killed him in a rage. The police build a prosecution case, but it hinges on testimony from the suspect's traumatised teenage daughter - whose delicate mental state makes McCoy uncertain how to proceed

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica investigates the murder of a crooked deputy, and she soon has not one but three suspects - the owner of an illegal casino, her own accountant and his daughter's jilted lover. Whodunit, starring Angela Lansbury, Ron Masak and William Windom

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Journalist Nick Wallis joins police forces around the nation to discover how CCTV and technological advances are helping to bring criminals to justice. The programme reveals how essential surveillance cameras have become in the fight against crime and features footage of people caught red-handed
